0.title: Healthtech startup Fitterfly raises $12 mn in Series A funding
0.article_body: Mumbai-based healthtech startup Fitterfly has raised $12 million in a Series A funding round. Led by Amazon Smbhav Venture Fund and Fireside Ventures, the round saw participation from 9 Unicorns, Venture Catalysts, Nihar Parikh of 4point0 Health Ventures, and Sriram Natarajan of Molbio. The startup, founded in 2016 by Dr Arbinder Singal and Shailesh Gupta, has over 200 employees.

1.title: Automation platform AppViewX raises $20 mn in Series B round
1.article_body: Seattle-based automation startup, AppViewX, raised $20 million in a Series B funding round led by existing investor Brighton Park Capital. The startup has also announced that it will be inaugurating its 100-seater global centre of excellence in Bengaluru. The firm will use the capital to maximise its go-to-market operations and product development and overall revenue growth strategies.

2.title: Alt News Co-founder Zubair released from jail 24 days after arrest
2.article_body: Fact-checker and Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was released from Delhi's Tihar Jail on Wednesday, 24 days after he was arrested over a 2018 tweet. Earlier in the day, the Supreme Court granted interim bail to Zubair in all six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh. The court had ordered his release at 6 pm on Wednesday.

3.title: Syria breaks diplomatic ties with Ukraine in reciprocal measure
3.article_body: Syria on Wednesday formally broke diplomatic relations with Ukraine in response to a similar move by Ukraine days earlier. Syria, which is a close ally of Russia, recognised two Ukrainian separatist regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent last month, following which Ukraine broke ties with the country. Russia had recognised these regions as independent before invading Ukraine.

4.title: 118 civilians killed in J&K since August 2019: Centre
4.article_body: Since the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019, 118 civilians have been killed in Jammu and Kashmir including five Kashmiri Pandits and 16 other Hindus and Sikhs. Union Minister of State Nityanand Rai said that no Pandit has migrated from J&K since August 2019. He added that there has been a decline in the number of terror attacks since 2018.

5.title: Rainbow coloured pic of Pluto shared by NASA, social media users react
5.article_body: NASA shared a translated colour image of Pluto, created by New Horizons scientists to highlight colour differences between its distinct regions. "Pluto has a complex...surface with jumbled mountains, carved-out valleys, old, heavily cratered terrain sitting right next to...icy plains," wrote NASA. "Pluto is where the party's at," a comment read while another person wrote, "This is so beautiful!"

6.title: 5 arrested for allegedly torching UP building in 1984 anti-Sikh riots
6.article_body: A Special Investigation Team on Wednesday arrested five men who are accused of setting a building on fire in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Three people had been burnt to death in the fire. The arrested men, all residents of Kidwai Nagar, have been identified as Anil Kumar Pandey, Sriram, Mustaqeem, Abdul Waheed and Irshad Khan.

7.title: OnePlus to launch OnePlus 10T 5G and OxygenOS 13 on August 3
7.article_body: OnePlus announced that its second flagship smartphone of 2022, the OnePlus 10T 5G along with the all new OxygenOS 13 will be launched in New York City on August 3. The OnePlus 10T is powered by the Snapdragon®️ 8+ Gen 1 Mobile Platform, while OxygenOS 13 comes with refreshed design, AODs, Zen Mode and enhanced gaming, connectivity, and safety.

8.title: Xiaomi India launches Redmi K50i 5G smartphone & Redmi Earbuds 3 Lite
8.article_body: Xiaomi India has launched Redmi K50i 5G, starting at ₹25,999. The ultimate 'India-ready 5G' phone comes with flagship MediaTek Dimensity 8100 chipset, 144Hz 7-stage AdaptiveSync FFS Display, triple-camera setup, 5080mAh battery, 67W in-box turbocharger, Dolby Vision™️ & Dolby Atmos®️ certification, the brand stated. Available on mi.com & Amazon.in, Xiaomi also launched Redmi Buds 3 Lite at ₹1,999.

9.title: UP Minister Dinesh Khatik resigns, says 'was sidelined because I am a Dalit'
9.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Jal Shakti Dinesh Khatik on Wednesday resigned from his post alleging that he was sidelined because he is a Dalit. He sent his resignation letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah instead of CM Yogi Adityanath. "My working as a minister of state is... waste for the Dalit community," Khatik said in the letter.

10.title: 13 lakh electric vehicles registered in country: Nitin Gadkari
10.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Wednesday informed the Rajya Sabha that over 13 lakh electric vehicles are registered in the country. However, the number excludes data from Andhra Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Telangana and Lakshadweep. Under Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Electric Vehicles (FAME) Phase-II scheme, 2,877 public EV charging stations have been sanctioned in 68 cities, Gadkari said.

11.title: Door-to-door checking done: Haryana Home Minister on DSP's killing
11.article_body: A day after DSP Surender Singh was killed by mining mafia in Haryana's Nuh, Home Minister Anil Vij said door-to-door checking was done to arrest the accused. "We're investigating the matter. We're taking strict measures to ensure law and order in the state," he said. The accused truck driver was arrested from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, Anil Vij said.

12.title: Delhi HC allows minor rape victim to terminate 26-week pregnancy
12.article_body: Delhi HC has allowed a minor rape victim to undergo medical termination of her 26-week pregnancy, saying her misery would stand compounded if she was forced to become a mother at a tender age. Forcing the victim to go through the pregnancy would scar her psyche, the Court observed. It also directed hospital to preserve terminal foetus for DNA testing.

13.title: Rishi Sunak among final 2 contenders for UK PM, wins most votes in latest voting round
13.article_body: Former British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Wednesday made it through to final stage of the leadership contest to replace Prime Minister Boris Johnson. Sunak won the fifth voting round of Tory MPs with 137 votes, while second-placed Truss won the support of 113 MPs. Former Defence Secretary Penny Mordaunt was eliminated with 105 votes.

14.title: Hope Pant takes care of his weight; he can emerge as a model, earn in crores: Akhtar
14.article_body: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is a little overweight. He added, "I hope he takes care of that. Because India's market is big. He's good-looking. He can emerge as a model, earn in crores." Akhtar further said, "In times to come, Rishabh Pant is going to be a superstar."

15.title: TRS workers protest against GST on packaged milk, dairy products
15.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leaders and workers took to the streets across the state on Wednesday to protest against the Centre's decision to impose Goods and Services Tax (GST) on packaged milk and dairy products. "The party condemns the anti-people policies of the Centre and will continue to resist till a rollback is announced," TRS MLA Danam Nagender said.

16.title: 472 kg marijuana worth ₹47 lakh seized in Assam's Karimganj, 1 held
16.article_body:
Police on Tuesday night seized 472 kg of marijuana worth ₹47 lakh from a truck in Karimganj district along the Assam-Tripura border and arrested one person in connection with the case. 
"The truck was coming from Tripura side...We apprehended the truck driver identified as Sajala Debbarman," Niranjan Das, in-charge of Churaibari police watch post, said.

17.title: J&K makes face masks, social distancing mandatory amid COVID surge
17.article_body: As COVID-19 cases spike in Jammu and Kashmir, wearing masks and social distancing have been made mandatory in all public places including colleges, schools, markets, multiplexes and banks. The Deputy Commissioner of Jammu issued a circular stating that officials must ensure that all preventive measures are implemented. Jammu and Kashmir reported 333 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

18.title: Police kills arms smuggler in encounter in Assam
18.article_body: An arms smuggler named Adam Ali was killed in an encounter with Assam Police on Tuesday. Police had launched a search operation on Tuesday in Dhubri, where Ali had taken shelter. "When the police team reached the area...Ali fired and the police team retaliated," SP Abhijit Gurav said. "[Ali] was involved in anti-national activity, Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen...arms smuggling [and] hawala," he added.

19.title: Wipro's net profit falls 21% YoY to ₹2,564 cr in Q1, revenue up 16%
19.article_body: Wipro Limited on Wednesday reported a 20.93% YoY decline in its consolidated profit after tax to ₹2,563.6 crore for the March-June quarter. The company's consolidated revenue, however, rose 15.51% YoY to ₹22,001 crore in Q1 FY23, up from ₹19,045 crore in Q1 FY22. "At 15% of operating margins, we believe that we have bottomed out," said Wipro CFO Jatin Dalal.

20.title: Truck driver who ran over DSP amid mining raid in Haryana arrested from Rajasthan
20.article_body: Haryana Police on Wednesday arrested the truck driver who allegedly ran over DSP Surender Singh during an illegal mining check in Nuh a day ago. The accused named Mittar was nabbed from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said. The DSP had signalled a stone-laden truck to slow down, but the driver instead sped up and ran him over.

21.title: 4 dead as ambulance carrying patient crashes at K'taka toll booth, incident caught on CCTV
21.article_body: An ambulance carrying a patient and two attendants lost control and crashed into a toll booth in Karnataka's Udupi district today, killing all three and a toll attendant. The driver was injured, police said. In the video footage, some men who appear to be toll operators can be seen scurrying to remove three plastic barricades on seeing the ambulance approach.

22.title: 742 kms of metro rail lines operational in 19 cities: Govt report
22.article_body: Nearly 742 kilometres of metro rail lines are operational in 19 cities across the country, according to a parliamentary panel report. About 1,037 kilometres of metro rail lines are being laid in 27 cities, the report said. Cities like Varanasi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kozhikode, Guwahati and Chandigarh are aspiring to have a metro rail system, the report added.

23.title: 2 dead, 2,642 held from rly premises over Agnipath protests: Govt
23.article_body: Two people died, 35 were injured and 2,642 were arrested from railway premises during the protests against the Agnipath scheme, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw informed the Parliament on Wednesday. The minister said because of strikes and agitations, the railways has incurred a loss of ₹151 crore in 2019-20, ₹904 crore in 2020-21 and ₹62 crore in 2021-22.

24.title: Hope to complete Sri Lanka aid talks as soon as possible: IMF chief
24.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) hopes to complete negotiations with Sri Lanka on a bailout package "as quickly as possible", IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva said. "The moment there is a government [in Sri Lanka], we can continue our discussions and our team will be there," Georgieva said. Sri Lanka needs about $5 billion in next six months to cover basic necessities.

25.title: Which are the world's most peaceful countries as India is ranked 135th?
25.article_body: As per the recently released Global Peace Index (GPI) 2022, which ranks 163 of the world's nations in terms of 'peacefulness', India has been ranked 135th. Iceland has been named the most peaceful country, while New Zealand has been ranked the second-most peaceful country. New Zealand is followed by Ireland, Denmark, Austria, Portugal, Slovenia, Czech Republic and Singapore.

26.title: SC to hear AAP's plea against postponement of MCD polls on July 26
26.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it will hear on July 26 the Aam Aadmi Party's plea challenging the postponement of Municipal Corporations of Delhi elections. The AAP's representative said the three municipal corporations in Delhi have been unified and their terms expired in May this year. Delimitation shouldn't be the sole reason to postpone the polls, the AAP contended.

27.title: Govt shares state-wise list of employment generated by DPIIT-recognised startups
27.article_body: The government told Lok Sabha that Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)-recognised startups have generated nearly 7.68 lakh jobs since Startup India initiative was launched in 2016. As per a list, such startups in Maharashtra created 1.46 lakh jobs, followed by Karnataka (1.03 lakh jobs) and Delhi (87,643 jobs). Uttar Pradesh came fourth with 67,694 jobs.

28.title: B'desh PM invites Mamata to visit newly-constructed Padma Bridge
28.article_body: Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina has invited West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to come and see the newly-constructed Padma Bridge there. "This bridge is expected to strengthen bilateral ties between Bangladesh and West Bengal, or rather entire India and open up new avenues for bilateral trade," Hasina wrote in a letter to Banerjee. Notably, the 6.51-km-long bridge is Bangladesh's longest bridge.

29.title: Ex-K'taka minister Eshwarappa cleared of all charges in contractor suicide case
29.article_body: Former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa was on Wednesday cleared of all charges by the police in connection with the alleged suicide of civil contractor Santosh Patil in April this year. In WhatsApp messages to his friends and the media, Patil had blamed Eshwarappa for his death. Recently, Patil's wife wrote to the Governor seeking a transparent investigation into the case.

30.title: Poor quality water being consumed in parts of Bengaluru
30.article_body: Poor quality water is being consumed in parts of Bengaluru with total dissolved solids and water hardness levels exceeding permissible limits in Electronic City, HSR Layout and Whitefield areas, according to a recent study. High TDS levels in water can cause nausea, lung irritation, among other health problems. The study used water samples taken between January and May this year.

31.title: NIA conducts raid in Madrasa, arrests teacher in Bihar
31.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted a raid in Jamia Maria Niswa Madrasa and arrested a teacher named Asghar Ali in Bihar's Purvi Champaran district. NIA also recovered five bags full of books from Ali's house. This comes after police busted a potential terror module in Bihar and arrested accused with links to Islamic extremist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI).

32.title: Woman's body found stuffed inside iron box in Punjab, husband held
32.article_body: The Punjab Police on Tuesday arrested a man for the alleged murder of his wife after her body was found hidden inside a box in Ludhiana. ASI Satpal Singh said the woman's family, after not being able to reach the couple, reached their house. They checked the rooms and found the deceased's body inside an iron box, Singh added.

33.title: Govt approves 6,000 transit shelters for Kashmiri migrants in J&K
33.article_body: Centre has approved construction of 6,000 transit shelters for Kashmiri migrants employed in the valley under a special package of the prime minister, Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai told Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. "Construction of 1,025 units has been completed or substantially completed," he added. Rai also said the government has acquired land for various public purposes.

34.title: B'luru woman with heart issue airlifted from US to Chennai in 26 hrs
34.article_body: A 67-year-old woman with a critical heart condition was airlifted from Portland in the United States to Chennai in a 26-hour long flight, becoming one of the longest aero-medical evacuations to India. The airlift cost the family $133,000 (a little over ₹1 crore), reports said. The woman was transported to Chennai in two separate private jets, reports added.

35.title: Faridabad Police arrests 5 for cheating 335 on pretext of giving jobs
35.article_body: Faridabad Police on Sunday arrested five men for allegedly duping 335 people across the country on the pretext of providing them with jobs. The accused would contact job seekers by posing as recruiters and ask them to deposit various fees after conducting job interviews, according to the police. The police have recovered ₹3.97 lakh from the accused.

36.title: 'Pad Man' producer Prerna Arora charged with money laundering in alleged fraud of ₹31cr
36.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a case of money laundering against producer Prerna Arora, known for producing films including 'Pad Man' and 'Toilet - Ek Prem Katha'. Prerna allegedly faces fraud charges of ₹31 crore. ED summoned her today but she didn't appear as she's not in Mumbai. On her behalf, her lawyer reached the ED office and sought time.

37.title: Girl with rare condition undergoes surgery in Delhi to fix spine curvature
37.article_body: A 12-year-old girl from Kyrgyzstan with an extremely deformed spine underwent surgery at a private hospital in Delhi that reduced her spine curvature from 130 degrees to 30 degrees, according to a statement. The girl suffers from Progressive Dorsolumbar Scoliosis, a rare condition that affects about three children out of every one lakh.

38.title: 2 killed, 8 injured as under-construction bridge collapses in U'khand
38.article_body: Two labourers were killed and eight were injured after an under-construction bridge collapsed on Rishikesh-Badrinath highway in Uttarakhand on Wednesday morning, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) said. "Two people died on the spot," SDRF spokesperson said. Rudraprayag DM, who visited the spot along with the officials concerned, said a high-level probe will be conducted into the matter.

39.title: Armed gunmen shoot 29 dogs dead in Qatar, injure many others
39.article_body: A group of armed gunmen stormed a secure factory area in Qatar and shot 29 dogs dead and injured many others. The gunmen claimed they shot dogs dead because a dog had bitten the son of a gunman, Doha-based animal rescue charity Paws Rescue Qatar said. "I'm genuinely shocked," a social media user commented, while another wrote, "It's barbaric."

40.title: Virat Kohli & Rohit Sharma drop in latest rankings for ODI batters, Pant jumps 25 places
40.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the latest rankings for ODI batters. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma dropped down one place each to be ranked fourth and fifth, respectively. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant, who slammed his maiden ODI hundred in the third ODI against England, jumped 25 places to be ranked 52nd. Further, Hardik Pandya jumped eight places to be ranked 42nd.

41.title: PMC to levy value-based property tax on 100 properties on pilot basis
41.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will levy value-based property tax on 100 properties on a pilot basis. This is being done in an attempt to bridge the gap in the amount of property tax levied on old and new properties. Currently, property tax is levied as per the ready reckoner rate of the year of the concerned property's registration.

42.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde stakes claim over Shiv Sena, sends letter to EC
42.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday night approached the Election Commission of India (ECI), staking claim over the Shiv Sena. CM Shinde on Tuesday said Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has recognised rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale as the party's floor leader in the Lower House of Parliament. Sanjay Raut on Tuesday called Shinde's faction "snakes".

43.title: 7 flights diverted, 40 delayed at Delhi airport after heavy rainfall
43.article_body: As heavy rains lashed Delhi on Wednesday, as many as seven flights were diverted and 40 were delayed at Delhi airport, as per reports. Vistara said its two Mumbai-Delhi flights were diverted to Jaipur and Indore due to heavy rainfall. Many parts of Delhi were waterlogged and traffic was affected in many areas after the rainfall.

44.title: PM Modi meets PT Usha after she takes oath in Parliament, shares pic
44.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met renowned former athlete PT Usha in Parliament after the latter took oath as Rajya Sabha MP on Wednesday. The Prime Minister shared a picture of him standing beside Usha on Twitter. He tweeted, "Glad to have met PT Usha ji in Parliament." Usha, 58, has won 18 gold medals for India at several international events.

45.title: Cheetahs to return to Indian forests for 1st time in nearly 70 yrs
45.article_body: India and Namibia on Wednesday signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to reintroduce cheetahs in the country after nearly seven decades. As per the agreement with Namibia, India will get eight cheetahs in two batches of four. MP's Kuno National Park is likely to receive the first tranche of cheetahs by August 15.

46.title: Hand over AIADMK headquarter keys to EPS: Madras HC to Tamil Nadu govt
46.article_body: The Madras High Court on Wednesday asked the Tamil Nadu government to hand over keys of AIADMK headquarters to Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami, also known as EPS. The court asked AIADMK cadres not to enter the office for one month to prevent untoward incidents. The office was sealed after a clash between supporters of EPS and O Panneerselvam.

47.title: Be fair: AAP MP urges Centre to give representation to Punjab in MSP panel
47.article_body: AAP MP Vikramjit Singh Sahney on Wednesday urged the Centre to "be fair" and include representatives from Punjab in the committee constituted on the minimum support price (MSP) along with the Commission for Agricultural Costs & Prices (CACP). Avoiding a dialogue with representatives of Punjab will not serve the purpose, Sahney said.

48.title: National Lok Adalat to be held in Noida on August 13
48.article_body: A National Lok Adalat will be organised in Noida on August 13, the district administration said on Tuesday. District Magistrate Suhas LY said that various cases, including criminal compoundable suit, family disputes and water bill payment disputes, will be adjudicated by the Lok Adalat. He also called upon people to turn out in large numbers and avail of this opportunity.

49.title: Gang of inter-state contract killers arrested for murder in Hyderabad
49.article_body: Four inter-state contract killers, who executed the murder of a businessman on the outskirts of Hyderabad five days ago, were arrested, the Rachakonda Police tweeted. Police said the accused killed a businessman, Ambati Raghupathi, for ₹30 lakh on July 15 at Dammaiguda. The prime accused in the case, 33-year-old Srikanth Reddy, was also arrested by the police.

50.title: EAM Jaishankar to address UNGA session in September
50.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will address the annual UN General Assembly session on September 24, according to the UN's provisional list of speakers. The General Debate of the 77th Session of the UNGA will be held from September 20 to 26. The Russia-Ukraine war and the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic are expected to be discussed at the annual meet.

51.title: CWG 2022-bound Indian athletes Dhanalakshmi, Aishwarya Babu fail dope test: Reports
51.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022-bound athletes Dhanalakshmi and Aishwarya Babu have failed dope test, as per reports. Sprinter Dhanalakshmi returned positive for a banned steroid, while Aishwarya returned positive for a banned substance after NADA officials took her sample during National Inter-State Athletics Championships last month. Aishwarya had broken the triple jump national record during the meet.

52.title: Satisfy hunger with tadka of jumlas: Rahul on GST on essential items
52.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over GST on packaged food items and said that PM will have to take back the move. "Recipe of Gabbar for people struggling with inflation: Make less, eat less, satisfy hunger with the tadka of jumlas," he said. Packaged food weighing less than 25kg will carry 5% GST.

53.title: Odisha STF seizes leopard skin, 1 arrested
53.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of Odisha Police seized a leopard skin and arrested one person on charges of smuggling in Koraput, officials said on Wednesday. Based on a tip-off, a team of STF conducted a raid with the help of Ramgir Forest Officials near Ramgir Gupteswar Gate. Since 2020, the STF has arrested 43 wildlife criminals, an official said.

54.title: B'luru Police rescue boy within 3 hours of his abduction; 4 held
54.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Tuesday rescued a 19-year-old college student within three hours of his abduction and arrested four of the alleged perpetrators, with assistance from the Chitradurga Police. The vehicle carrying the abducted teen, Jagadish, was tracked down by the police using FASTag details. Jagadish was abducted as his father owed one of the accused around ₹3 crore, probe found.

55.title: Venture capital firm First Cheque closes second fund at $5 mn
55.article_body: Early-stage venture capital firm First Cheque has raised $5 million from global investors for its second fund. Before the fund was launched, First Cheque operated as an AngelList Syndicate and invested in more than 100 startups in the last three years. The firm is looking to back first-time founders and will invest $100,000 in each of its portfolio companies.

56.title: Agritech startup Growcoms raises $1 mn in pre-Series A fund
56.article_body: Kochi-based agritech startup, Growcoms, has raised $1 million in its pre-Series A funding round led by Info Edge. The firm, supported by Kerala Startup Mission and incubated in Indigram Labs Foundation, was founded in 2021 by George Kurian Kannanthanam, Bibin Mathews and Narendranath P. The firm focuses on making farmers aware about enhancing the quality of produce, said Co-founder Kannanthanam.

57.title: Follow ringmaster US Federal Reserve to save local currency: Uday Kotak
57.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO Uday Kotak on Tuesday said central banks which don't follow "ringmaster US Federal Reserve" have their local currencies crushed. "Look at Japan, a 30%+ depreciation. That's the power of the US $," Kotak tweeted. He added that central banks globally take a cue from the US Federal Reserve and decide their monetary policies accordingly.

58.title: Kolkata residents allege air pollution due to cats; NGT forms panel
58.article_body: Residents of an apartment in Kolkata have alleged that droppings, hair and dander of cats kept by a flat owner were causing air pollution. National Green Tribunal has formed a three-member panel to look into the matter. The residents said that the flat owner has 20 to 25 cats and she feeds 15 to 20 stray cats in the corridor.

59.title: HC orders handing of AIADMK headquarters' keys to Palaniswami
59.article_body: Madras High Court on Wednesday ordered to hand over the keys of AIADMK headquarters to current AIADMK Interim General Secretary Edappadi Palaniswami. The court stated that the party cadres or workers are not allowed to enter the headquarters for a month. The headquarters, 'MGR Maaligai', was sealed earlier this month after violence erupted between supporters of Palaniswami and O Panneerselvam.

60.title: 4 Delhi women arrested with 6.5 kg cannabis; search on to nab supplier
60.article_body: Delhi Police's Anti-Narcotics Cell arrested four women drug peddlers near Najafgarh's Anaj Mandi and recovered 6.5 kg cannabis from their possession during a raid, an official said on Wednesday. Based on a tip-off that women sell drugs at Indira market, a trap was laid to arrest them. According to police, search is on to arrest the main supplier of drugs.

61.title: A company has asked me to donate sperm to create more Elon Musks: Musk's father
61.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol has claimed he has been asked by a company in Colombia "to donate sperm to impregnate women and create a new generation of Elon Musks". "They haven't offered me any money but they have offered me first-class travel and five-star hotel accommodation and all that sort of stuff," the 76-year-old told The Sun.

62.title: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri booked for allegedly abusing T'gana CM
62.article_body: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri was booked on Wednesday for allegedly abusing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. Arvind, who made the alleged comments at an event in Hyderabad last week, was accused of degrading the CM's image and inciting hate towards the state government in the FIR. Notably, Arvind recently alleged that his convoy was attacked by TRS workers.

63.title: NCP workers float paper boats in potholes at Pune's Swargate junction
63.article_body: NCP workers floated paper boats in potholes at the Swargate junction in Pune to mark a protest on Wednesday. This comes a day after the Pune Municipal Corporation said that 90% of potholes on city roads had been repaired from July 15 to 18. The party workers said BJP was responsible for the bad state of the roads.

64.title: 2 gangsters involved in Sidhu Moosewala's murder case killed in encounter
64.article_body: Two gangsters involved in singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder case, namely Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh, were killed in a shootout with the police in Amritsar today, said Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav. He confirmed that three policemen also suffered minor injuries. "We have recovered an AK47 and a pistol," Punjab DGP further stated.

65.title: Barca only club to have no money but buy every player: Bayern's Nagelsmann
65.article_body: Following Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski's transfer to Barcelona, Bayern Munich manager Julian Nagelsmann said, "Barcelona [are] the only club that [have] no money but then...[buy] every player they want." "I do not know how [they do it]. It is kind of weird...crazy," added Nagelsmann. Barcelona President Joan Laporta Estruch had recently said the club is in the "ICU" financially.

66.title: Pak record highest successful run chase at Galle Stadium in Test win vs SL
66.article_body: Pakistan recorded the highest successful run chase in Test cricket at the Galle International Stadium as they defeated Sri Lanka by four wickets. Pakistan chased down a target of 342 runs to win the match and take a 1-0 lead in the two-Test series. The previous highest successful fourth-innings chase was 268 by Sri Lanka versus New Zealand in 2019.

67.title: 58% of total work of Mumbai Coastal Road Project completed: BMC
67.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday confirmed that 58% of the total work of the Mumbai Coastal Road Project (South) has been completed. The reclamation of 107 hectares out of the total 111 hectares that constitute 97% of the project has been completed. Moreover, 70% of work on the sea wall has also been finished.

68.title: Homes, hospital evacuated as wildfire rages near Athens
68.article_body: Hundreds of people were evacuated from their homes as firefighters on Wednesday battled a wildfire that raged for a second day in the mountains near Athens. The wildfire also prompted authorities to evacuate a hospital. About 485 firefighters and 120 fire engines have been deployed to contain the blaze, which has destroyed a number of homes and businesses.

69.title: Could not find spark with the ball: Buttler on defeat against SA
69.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said they couldn't find the spark with the ball in their defeat against South Africa on Tuesday. "It was a fantastic partnership between Rassie van der Dussen and Aiden Markram and we were not able to break that," he stated. South Africa posted 333/5 and then bundled out England for 271 to win the first ODI.

70.title: Hardik got a good shock when he was out of team for 1-2 yrs: Akhtar
70.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said Hardik Pandya got a "good shock" when he was out of the team for one-two years as he was unfit and casual. "He's become serious about his fitness," added Akhtar. Talking about Rishabh Pant, Akhtar stated, "My advice...would be to improve his physique...He is a little overweight." "He's good-looking...[and] can emerge as a model, earn in crores."

71.title: World chess champion Magnus Carlsen to give up his title
71.article_body: World number one chess player Magnus Carlsen, who's the defending world chess champion, said that he'll not defend his world championship title in 2023. "I am not motivated to play another match. I simply feel that I don't have a lot to gain," he said. "It didn't mean anything to me," he added, talking about defending the title in 2021.

72.title: Resigning only way when not respected: Akhilesh on UP minister's resignation
72.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav shared his take on the resignation of BJP MLA Dinesh Khatik, who alleged that the Yogi government sidelined him as he is a Dalit. "Where you are not respected as a minister but insulted because you're a Dalit, resigning from such a discriminatory BJP government is the only way," he tweeted in Hindi.

73.title: Putin's Iran trip shows how isolated Russia has become: US
73.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's trip to Iran shows how Russia has become isolated amid the Ukraine war, US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said. Putin arrived in Tehran on Tuesday and held talks with Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and President Ebrahim Raisi. This is Putin's second trip abroad since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

74.title: Vikram Bhatt's romance with Sushmita started during 'Dastak' making in Seychelles: Mahesh
74.article_body: Mahesh Bhatt, coming out in support of Sushmita Sen who recently announced she's dating Lalit Modi, also shared how she met her former partner Vikram Bhatt. "During the making of 'Dastak', Vikram's romance with Sushmita started in Seychelles," he stated. "Vikram was my right hand...doing most of my work. So, he used to interact with her more vigorously," Bhatt added.

75.title: Windshield of Go First's Delhi-Guwahati flight cracks mid-air, flight diverted to Jaipur
75.article_body: The windshield of Go First's Delhi-Guwahati flight cracked mid-air after which the flight was diverted to Jaipur due to bad weather in Delhi, Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) officials said. This is the third incident of technical malfunction on a Go First aircraft in two days. On Tuesday, Go First's Mumbai-Leh and Srinagar-Delhi flights faced engine snags.

76.title: Bihar Cabinet approves lease exemption of up to 80% on govt land
76.article_body: Nitish Kumar-led Bihar Cabinet on Tuesday announced an exemption of up to 80% on land leases under the Bihar Industrial Area Development Authority (BIADA). It approved the decision for 54 units under BIADA. The rate of BIADA units has been decreased by 80% for 15 units, 60% and 40% for 12 units each and 20% for 15 units.

77.title: Maha man sets himself, wife & son on fire; he dies, other 2 survive
77.article_body: A 58-year-old man died after he set himself, his wife and son on fire while all three of them were in a car in Nagpur on Tuesday, police said. A suicide note recovered from the man's house said he was ending his life due to financial crisis, police added. The man's 55-year-old wife and 30-year-old son sustained serious burn injuries.

78.title: Gr Noida development body to sterilise street dogs free of charge
78.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) will sterilise all street dogs in its jurisdiction, which aren't covered by resident welfare associations, for free, officials said. "GNIDA will [also] bear...cost of...rabies vaccination for street dogs," a senior official from the development body said. Additionally, GNIDA will set up animal hospital and shelter for dogs and other animals.

79.title: Policeman tries to stop truck in Gujarat, it mows him down
79.article_body: A truck mowed down a policeman in Gujarat's Borsad on Wednesday at 1 am. Constable Kiran Raj was trying to stop the "suspicious" truck from Rajasthan when it ran over him, ANI reported. Raj died during treatment in hospital. This is the third incident in India in 24 hours in which a police officer was run over by a truck.

80.title: Ukraine did not fulfil terms of preliminary peace deal: Putin
80.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that Ukraine had not fulfilled the terms of what he described as a preliminary peace deal agreed with the Ukrainian government in March. However, Putin did not elaborate on his claim. Notably, there was no immediate response from the Ukrainian government to the Russian President's remarks.

81.title: FM will reply to Opposition's questions once she recovers from COVID: BJP's Joshi
81.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said that the central government is ready for discussion on inflation in Parliament. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is down with COVID and she will reply to questions once she recovers and when Business Advisory Committee decides and both chairs give permission. His statements come after Congress claimed that government is not allowing discussion on GST rates.

82.title: Is it unparliamentary to discuss inflation?: Priyanka Gandhi to PM Modi
82.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday alleged that PM Narendra Modi is increasing household expenditure while shying away from discussion on it in Parliament. "Is it 'unparliamentary' to discuss inflation?" she tweeted. Priyanka said that the government has increased the burden of inflation by imposing "Grihasthi Satyanash Tax (GST)" (household destruction tax) on grains, jaggery and curd.

83.title: DDA must register real estate projects with us: Delhi-RERA Chairman
83.article_body: Delhi Development Authority (DDA) must register its real-estate projects with the regulator to protect the interest of property buyers, said Delhi-Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) Chairman Anand Kumar. Delhi-RERA has the power to take action against organisations that fail to register projects with them, he said. "If DDA delays [its] project...who is going to suffer? The buyer," he added.

84.title: 37-yr-old man held for cheating people with fake job offers in Mumbai
84.article_body: A 37-year-old man, Sandeep Raut, was arrested for cheating several people in Mumbai by promising jobs at companies like ONGC, RBI and other institutions. Police said the accused has over 18 cases registered against him across Maharashtra. Mumbai Police raided the guest house where he was staying and seized 12 ID cards, five appointment letters, rubber stamps and notary papers.

85.title: 30-yr-old woman kills self by jumping into Hussain Sagar lake in Hyd
85.article_body: A 30-year-old woman, identified as Sailaja, allegedly died by suicide after jumping into Hussain Sagar lake in Hyderabad on Wednesday morning. According to the police, the woman jumped into the lake from the NTR Garden side and locals who noticed this, informed the police. The woman's body was shifted to Gandhi Hospital mortuary and a case has been registered.

86.title: In 21st century, we must give people right to live life on own terms: Mahesh on Sushmita
86.article_body: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt, speaking about Sushmita Sen, told ETimes, "She has the guts to live on her own dictates." "My personal belief is that we must in the second decade of...21st century give human beings...right to live life on their own terms," he added. Sushmita recently announced that she is dating Lalit Modi.

87.title: 5 officers under UP minister Jitin Prasada suspended over irregularities
87.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government suspended five senior officers of the Public Works Department (PWD) under PWD Minister Jitin Prasada over alleged irregularities in transfers during the current transfer session. This comes after Prasada's Officer on Special Duty (OSD) Anil Kumar Pandey was removed. CM Yogi Adityanath had ordered a probe on July 12 following complaints of irregularities in the transfers.

88.title: Fans erect 75-feet banner of 'Liger' actor Vijay Deverakonda in Hyderabad
88.article_body: Fans of actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will be seen in the film 'Liger' and starred in the movie 'Arjun Reddy', reportedly erected a 75-feet banner where the actor can be seen shirtless, at Sudarshan 35MM theatre in Hyderabad. The banner has been put for the trailer launch of 'Liger' which will take place tomorrow. 'Liger' marks Vijay's first Bollywood film.

89.title: 2 burglars held for stealing valuables worth ₹2.5 lakh from a Mumbai house
89.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested two burglars, Shakib Shaukat Ali Ansari and Ahil Haroon Chaudhary, who used to visit cities on the pretext of travelling and commit burglaries. Police officials claimed the accused stole cash and ornaments worth about ₹2.5 lakh from a house in Malad last month. The accused were arrested from Delhi and Uttar Pradesh.

90.title: Ground will change but not your stubbornness: PM Modi to CWG athletes
90.article_body: While interacting with athletes who will represent India at the CWG 2022, PM Narendra Modi gave a message to those athletes who'll represent India at the international level for the first time. "I'd say the ground has changed, not your mood, not your stubbornness. The goal is to see the tricolour fluttering...make an impact with...strong game," said PM Modi.

91.title: Those who've played 1-2 matches are giving opinions on Kohli: Kamran Akmal
91.article_body: Ex-Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal has criticised those questioning Virat Kohli's current form, stating that every cricketer "goes through these phases". "Some players endure it for a brief period, some...for long...[but] people who've played one-two matches are giving opinions on him. I can only laugh," added Akmal. Kohli last scored a century in international cricket in November 2019.

92.title: Delhi-NCR to witness moderate to heavy rainfall, yellow alert issued
92.article_body: With parts of Delhi-NCR witnessing heavy rain on Wednesday, the IMD has issued a yellow alert for the national capital. The IMD forecast for the next two hours shows a likelihood of moderate to heavy intensity rainfall. The department's forecast alludes to the possibility of waterlogging and traffic disruptions. Moderate rainfall is expected on Thursday, Friday and Saturday as well.

93.title: Turkish President keeps Putin waiting ahead of talks in Iran; video surfaces
93.article_body: A video showing Russian President Vladimir Putin waiting for his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdoğan ahead of talks in Iran on Tuesday has surfaced on social media. In footage of the meeting, Putin was seen mouth twitching and his stance shifting as he waited almost a minute. It is Putin's second trip outside of Russia since he invaded Ukraine.

94.title: Joe Russo arrives in Mumbai ahead of 'The Gray Man' premiere, pics surface
94.article_body: Filmmaker Joe Russo has arrived in Mumbai ahead of the premiere of his upcoming film 'The Gray Man'. Pictures of 'The Gray Man' co-director Joe Russo have surfaced as he was spotted at the Kalina airport in Mumbai. Dhanush, who is part of the film, also arrived in Mumbai. Ryan Gosling and Chris Evans star in the film.

95.title: Told Salman 'You won't look back after this film': Govinda on 'Partner'
95.article_body: Discussing the film 'Partner' where he starred with actor Salman Khan, actor Govinda said, "Once I was leaving the set and randomly...told Salman...'You won't look back after this film', and that's...what happened." "Salman and I...have a love-hate relationship," Govinda had said, discussing their relationship. Salman had shared that he was "very scared" to act with Govinda at one point.

96.title: Film with Prabhas will go on the floors in September: 'RRR' producer
96.article_body: Producer DVV Danayya, who also produced SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', has said that his upcoming project with actor Prabhas will go on the floors in September. He further revealed that the film will completely be shot in India and the process of casting the leading lady for the film is going on. The film will be a supernatural action thriller.

97.title: Cyberabad Police destroy drugs worth ₹2.5 crore
97.article_body: The Cyberabad Police have destroyed drugs worth about ₹2.5 crore by incineration at Hyderabad Waste Management Project in Dundigal. These drugs included a total of 1338.05 kg of ganja (cannabis), 485 ml of weed oil and 11 grams of cocaine. "[We] have built a robust informant network to assist combat the drug problem," police said.

98.title: SC grants bail to Mohammed Zubair in all 6 cases registered across UP
98.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted bail to Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair in all the six cases registered against him across UP for hurting religious sentiments through tweets. The SIT formed by the UP DGP is "redundant and must be disbanded," the court said. Transfer all cases to the Special Cell of the Delhi Police, the court ordered.

99.title: Indonesian court rejects call to legalise marijuana for medical use
99.article_body: Indonesia's Constitutional Court on Wednesday rejected a judicial review of country's narcotics law on legalising use of marijuana for medicinal purposes. The rejection came as three mothers of children with cerebral palsy had filed judicial review of law, arguing the need to use marijuana to treat symptoms. The court urged government to "immediately" conduct research on therapeutic use of drug.

100.title: Scientists discover 2 new crocodile species that lived 15-18 mn years ago
100.article_body: Scientists have discovered two new crocodile species known as giant dwarf crocodiles - Kinyang mabokoensis and Kinyang tchernovi that lived between 15 and 18 million years ago. These crocodiles may have grown to over 3.5 m in size. They likely preyed on early humans and once inhabited east Africa before "inexplicably becoming extinct", scientists from the University of Iowa said.

101.title: Heavy rains cause waterlogging in parts of Delhi, traffic affected
101.article_body: Heavy rains lashed parts of Delhi on Wednesday, causing waterlogging in low-lying areas and affecting traffic movement. People shared pictures and videos on Twitter of rainwater gushing into residential areas. Delhi Traffic Police advised people to check the weather before heading out. IMD has predicted a cloudy sky, moderate rain or thundershowers in Delhi over the next three days.

102.title: UP Minister Dinesh Khatik resigns, says officials kept him in the dark
102.article_body: Dinesh Khatik, Minister of State for Jal Shakti in the UP government, has offered his resignation saying department officials didn't listen to him or share information about his ministry. In his resignation letter addressed to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Khatik claimed he was not kept in the loop by officials. He also alleged widespread corruption in Namami Gange scheme.

103.title: Protest erupts in Sri Lanka as Ranil Wickremesinghe becomes Prez
103.article_body: A group of people protested outside the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo on Wednesday after the election of Ranil Wickremesinghe as the country's new President. "We're shocked...He will start controlling us in a different way. As protesters, we will start our struggle again," one of the protesters said. Notably, Wickremesinghe had received 134 votes in the 225-member Parliament.

104.title: I love Alia Bhatt's work & her spirit, I look forward to her work: Ananya
104.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has revealed that she has been a fan of actress Alia Bhatt "all along". "I love her work...I love her spirit. I'm always looking forward to her work," she added. Speaking about Alia, Ananya further said, "There's so much she packs in, with so much nuance and novelty....she has some amazing pieces of work to her credit."

105.title: 4 arrested for offering Maha BJP MLA a ministerial post for ₹100 cr
105.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested four men for allegedly offering Rahul Kul, BJP MLA from Maharashtra's Daund, a ministerial post for ₹100 crore. Kul met one of the accused in South Mumbai where he bargained to reduce the offer to ₹90 crore. Mumbai Police's Anti Extortion Cell had laid a trap to arrest the accused before their second meeting with Kul.

106.title: I salute Sushmita Sen for living life on her own terms: Mahesh Bhatt
106.article_body: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt defended Sushmita Sen after she was trolled over her relationship with Lalit Modi. "What I salute her for is that she has lived her life on her own terms," he stated. "My...belief is that we must in the second decade of the 21st century give human beings the right to live life on their...terms," he added.

107.title: Public wants Parliament to work: Om Birla on sloganeering by Oppn
107.article_body: On the third day of monsoon session of the Parliament on Wednesday, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said the public wants the Parliament to work. His statement came as Lok Sabha was adjourned amid sloganeering by the Opposition MPs today. "I want to tell those members who are indulging in sloganeering that they should take part in discussions," Birla added.

108.title: Fight breaks out between 2 groups at Noida's Amity University, 3 held
108.article_body: The Noida police have arrested three students of Amity University after a fight broke out between two groups on Tuesday, officials said on Wednesday. A fight broke out outside gate no. 2 of the university, following which one group beat the other with sticks, said Vikash Kumar Jain, Station House Officer, Noida Sector 126 police station.

109.title: 5 businessmen arrested for betting on India-England ODI in Lonavala
109.article_body: Five businessmen from Gujarat have been arrested from a bungalow in Lonavala for betting on the third one-day international (ODI) cricket match between India and England. The arrests were made after a raid was conducted on the bungalow located in Apti Village in Lonavala on July 17. They have been remanded to three-day police custody.

110.title: Sanjay Raut quotes Premchand, says betrayal is easiest way out
110.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Wednesday tweeted a picture of him holding hands with Uddhav Thackeray, and added a couple of lines of Premchand, which says that betrayal is the easiest way out. Raut on Tuesday launched a veiled attack on Twitter at Shinde's faction and said, "Do not leave the forest because of the fear of snakes."

111.title: Mumbai-Pune intercity train Pragati Exp to get one Vistadome coach
111.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) has decided to add one Vistadome coach in Pragati Express, which is a daily superfast intercity train plying between Pune and Mumbai via Panvel. Vistadome coaches are European-style coaches equipped with advanced features such as large glass windows, glass roofs, observation lounges etc. After the addition, CR will have total four trains running with Vistadome coaches.

112.title: Gangster involved in Sidhu Moosewala's murder shot dead by police in encounter
112.article_body: A gangster involved in killing of singer Sidhu Moosewala has been killed by Punjab Police in an encounter at a village in Punjab's Amritsar district. Three policemen are said to be injured in the encounter. The encounter broke out after police received a tip-off about accused Jagroop Rupa and Mannu Kusa being present in the village.

113.title: Some people tried to shoot me saying I'm spoiling Indian culture: Mallika
113.article_body: Actress Mallika Sherawat said some people tried to "shoot her" saying she is "spoiling" Indian culture. "I was an easy target because I had no support in Bollywood...Mahesh Bhatt once told me, 'You keep on falling and crying, so some people in Bollywood enjoy that'," added Mallika. Mallika stated her glamour was too much to handle for Indian women.

114.title: 6 die after drinking country liquor from hooch den in West Bengal
114.article_body: A number of people fell ill and were hospitalised allegedly after consuming country liquor from a hooch den in West Bengal's Howrah district on Tuesday. Six of them died on Wednesday. Few others are reportedly in a critical condition. The cause of the deaths has not been confirmed. However, police have arrested the owner of the liquor shop, Pratap Karmakar.

115.title: 27-year-old man held for unnatural sex with 7-year-old boy in Pune
115.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested a 27-year-old man for having unnatural sex with a seven-year-old boy. The accused lured the victim, who was playing in a garden, by offering him chocolate, police said. He later had unnatural sex with the boy and escaped from the spot, police added. The incident happened on Sunday and the accused was arrested on Monday.

116.title: Jennifer, Affleck were emotional at their wedding; they cried: Witness
116.article_body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck, who recently tied the knot, were emotional during their wedding, Kenosha Portis has said. Kenosha, who watched the ceremony, said, "It was so exciting...I'm like, 'Oh my god, this is Jennifer Lopez we're getting ready to marry'." Kenosha added the duo cried during the wedding and the couple's children "were right there behind them".

117.title: This shows his arrogance: Cong MP on Assam CM's 'tricolour' remark
117.article_body: Reacting to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s remark where he asked residents to hoist tricolour at homes to prove they're "genuine children" of 'Bharat Mata', Congress' Manickam Tagore said this shows Sarma's arrogance. "It should be the RSS that must be asked to put tricolour...because, for 52 long years, they didn't put Tiranga at their offices," Tagore added.

118.title: Cancerous tumour removed from man's body via rare procedure in Pune
118.article_body: A cancerous tumour was removed from a 63-year-old man's body via a rare procedure at a defence hospital in Pune. The patient underwent electro-cautery, which is a first-of-its-kind procedure in armed forces medical establishment, a release stated. "The three-hour-long [surgery was performed by]....five doctors...leading to relief of obstructions and...expansion of [patient's] left lung," it read.

119.title: Cocaine worth ₹15 cr seized from Zimbabwean national at IGI Airport
119.article_body: Customs officers at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport seized over 1 kg of cocaine worth ₹15 crore from a Zimbabwean national on Wednesday. The woman had arrived at the airport from Ethiopia's Addis Ababa and had concealed the narcotic in the soles of her sandals, ANI reported. She has been arrested under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985.

120.title: 'Ya Ali' singer Zubeen Garg hospitalised due to head injury after falling in bathroom
120.article_body: Singer Zubeen Garg, known for singing Ya Ali song from 'Gangster', has been admitted to a private hospital in Assam. The singer was admitted to the hospital after he sustained a head injury. Zubeen was reportedly in a resort in Dibrugarh when he slipped in the bathroom. Doctors revealed that he had a seizure following an epileptic fit, said reports.

121.title: Babar Azam completes 3,000 runs in Test cricket
121.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam completed 3,000 runs in Test cricket in the first Test against Sri Lanka at Galle. In his 73 innings, Babar has now scored 3,025 runs, including seven centuries and 22 half-centuries, at an average of 47.26. In the match against Sri Lanka, Babar scored 119 runs in the first innings and 55 in the second.

122.title: Parliament's functioning affected due to Modi govt's obstinacy: Congress
122.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led government is not allowing a discussion in Parliament on the issue of hike in GST on food items. "Government's obstinacy to not permit a debate on the matter has affected Parliament's functioning," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said. The Modi government is blocking desire of poor and middle class, he added.

123.title: Noida Police arrest 5 for robbery in over a dozen houses
123.article_body: Noida Police have arrested a gang of five men for allegedly carrying out robberies in over a dozen houses in Uttar Pradesh. Police said they also recovered jewellery worth around ₹8 lakh from them. "The gang moved in a car in the city for recce and targeted...houses that were locked. They decamped with mainly jewellery and cash," police said.

124.title: SC grants bail to Mohammed Zubair in all 6 cases, orders immediate release
124.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted interim bail to fact-checking website Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair in all the six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh and ordered immediate release. The court further clubbed all the FIRs registered against Zubair and transferred all of the FIRs lodged in Uttar Pradesh to Delhi Police Special Cell, according to report.

125.title: No plan to exempt cryptocurrency transactions from taxes: Govt
125.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the government is not considering any plan to reduce taxes on cryptocurrency transactions. In Budget 2022, the government had announced a flat 30% tax on income from cryptocurrencies and a 1% TDS on cryptocurrency transactions. Chaudhary said RBI has also started working on phased implementation of introduction of the Digital Rupee.

126.title: Why was she deployed on night duty?: J’khand BJP MP on sub-inspector’s death
126.article_body: Following a female sub-inspector, Sandhya Topno's death after being mowed down by a vehicle in Jharkhand, state BJP MP Sanjay Seth said the law and order has collapsed in the state. "It is a matter of investigation why Sandhya Topno was deployed on night duty. I will raise the issue...in Parliament today," Seth said on Wednesday.

127.title: MahaRERA to issue show-cause notices to 4,555 lapsed projects: Report
127.article_body: Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority (MahaRERA) will start issuing suo motu show-cause notices to developers of 4,555 lapsed real estate projects in the state from July 25, Moneycontrol reported citing senior MahaRERA officials. Of the 4,555 lapsed projects, Pune and Mumbai account for 1,216 and 649 lapsed projects. Notices will initially be issued to projects with over 50% booking.

128.title: Hardik Pandya said 'Sir, please get me through 2019 World Cup': Ex-India trainer
128.article_body: Talking about all-rounder Hardik Pandya, former Team India strength and conditioning coach Shanker Basu said that he was sore during the 2019 World Cup after having played IPL ahead of the ICC tournament. "He said to me 'Sir, please get me through this World Cup. I need to be fit'. And I got him through," Basu stated.

129.title: 5, including 2 children, killed after truck overturns on car in UP
129.article_body: At least five people, including two children, died and three others were injured after a truck overturned on their car in Uttar Pradesh. According to police, the accident took place on Tuesday night when eight members from two families were returning home after dinner. The accident occurred on the Raebareli-Prayagraj highway following which locals rushed to help the victims.

130.title: Noida twin towers to be loaded with explosives from Aug 2 to Aug 20
130.article_body: Noida's Supertech twin towers, located in Sector 93A, will be loaded with explosives from August 2 to August 20 and will be demolished at 2.30 pm the next day, the Noida Authority was told on Tuesday. When explosives would be placed, nobody except the staff of the demolition firm, Edifice Engineering, would be allowed inside the premises, officials said.

131.title: Ben Stokes gifts his last-ever ODI cap to a young fan, pics go viral
131.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes gifted his last-ever ODI cap to a young fan, with pictures of the fan wearing the signed cap going viral. "What a souvenir! Wow," a fan commented on the picture. "Lucky kid," wrote another. Stokes registered bowling figures of 5-0-44-0 and scored 5(11) in his last ODI against South Africa on Tuesday.

132.title: Encounter breaks out between Punjab Police, 2 suspected Moosewala killers; video surfaces
132.article_body: An encounter is underway in Bhakna village in Punjab's Amritsar district between the Punjab Police and two gangsters, believed to be involved in killing of singer Sidhu Moosewala. As per reports, Punjab Police got a tip-off about gangsters Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh alias Mannu Kusa being in the Bhakna village. A video of the encounter has surfaced online.

133.title: It's unfair to say ODI series vs WI is make or break for Dhawan: Rohan Gavaskar
133.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Rohan Gavaskar has said it's "unfair" to say that the upcoming three-match ODI series against West Indies is "make or break" for Shikhar Dhawan. "Dhawan is an exceptional performer in international cricket and he has been so for a while...Even if he stops playing tomorrow, he will look back at his career with a lot of pride," stated Rohan.

134.title: Businessman dies after setting car with family inside on fire in Maha; video surfaces
134.article_body: A 58-year-old businessman, who was going through financial troubles, died allegedly after he set himself and his family on fire in his car on Tuesday in Maharashtra's Nagpur. Police said his wife and son, who survived with severe burns, were unaware of the man's motive as he told them he was taking them for lunch. A suicide note was recovered.

135.title: When actor does film for his friends, it only breaks friendship: Ranbir
135.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that it's important for any profession to keep friendship and work separate. "I have seen it with my father (late actor Rishi Kapoor), that actors do film for their friends and that only breaks the friendship," he stated. Ranbir added, "For me, when I work, I prefer working...not socialising, so I like to be detached."

136.title: Frog wedding held in UP's Gorakhpur to end drought-like situation
136.article_body: A wedding ceremony of two frogs was held in UP's Gorakhpur in the belief that it will bring rain and end drought-like situation in the state that has received less-than-normal rain this monsoon. A large number of people reportedly attended the ceremony which was organised by the Hindu Mahasangh. The ritual will certainly work, people present at the ceremony said.

137.title: Destroyer of peace: China as US warship sails through Taiwan Strait
137.article_body: The US is a "maker of security risks" in the Taiwan Strait, the Chinese military said on Wednesday as another US warship sailed through the waterway. "The frequent provocations and showing off by...US fully demonstrate that...US is a destroyer of peace...in the Taiwan Strait," it added. The vessel transited through Taiwan Strait "in accordance with international law", US Navy said.

138.title: Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan approached for 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10': Reports
138.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketers Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan Singh and Suresh Raina have been reportedly approached to participate in the tenth season of the reality dance show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa'. Ex-Sri Lankan player Lasith Malinga has also been approached, the reports added. A source informed ETimes TV that there are high chances of Yuvraj doing the show and will soon sign the deal.

139.title: Director Sukumar said we have scope for 'Pushpa 3': Fahadh Faasil
139.article_body: Actor Fahadh Faasil has said there was no part one or part two when the film 'Pushpa' was offered to him. He added filmmaker Sukumar had originally planned the film to be an OTT series on red sandalwood. "Recently when I spoke with him, he said we have scope for 'Pushpa 3' also. We have so much material," he added.

140.title: Bumrah's execution was absolutely spot on against England: Agarkar
140.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar has said Jasprit Bumrah's execution was absolutely spot on during the ODIs against England. "Yes, there was help in the pitch, the conditions were suitable for fast bowling but the execution of his skills was absolutely spot on...We saw everything that a fast bowler should have," stated Agarkar. Bumrah picked eight wickets in two England ODIs.

141.title: Hyderabad police arrest 2 automobile thieves; recover 12 motorcycles
141.article_body: Hyderabad's Meerpet police on Tuesday arrested two people for stealing motorcycles. The police also seized 12 motorcycles and a mobile phone, all worth ₹6 lakh from the accused. They were arrested while going to dispose a stolen vehicle, police said. Both the accused are residents of Nagarkurnool district and have been involved in several cases across Hyderabad, police added.

142.title: Earth is basically empty of humans: Elon Musk on graphic showing population density
142.article_body: While commenting on a Twitter thread explaining population density across the world, Elon Musk wrote, "Earth is basically empty of humans." Earlier this month, Musk had said that he is "doing his best to help the underpopulation crisis" after reports claimed that he welcomed twins with Neuralink top executive Shivon Zilis in November 2021.

143.title: Maharashtra's Solapur BJP leader Shrikant Deshmukh booked for rape
143.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Shrikant Deshmukh was booked on rape charges after a woman filed a complaint in Pune. He promised to marry her and under that pretext raped her on multiple occasions in Solapur, Pune, Mumbai and Sangli, she alleged. A video of the woman and Deshmukh, in which she is seen accusing him of cheating her, recently surfaced online.

144.title: Former athlete PT Usha takes oath as Rajya Sabha MP
144.article_body: Renowned former Olympic track and field athlete PT Usha took oath as Rajya Sabha MP (Member of Parliament) on Wednesday. The government nominated her to the Upper House of the Parliament along with renowned composer Ilaiyaraaja, screenwriter V Vijayendra Prasad and spiritual leader Veerendra Heggade on July 6. Hailing from Kerala, PT Usha is one of India's most iconic sportspersons.

145.title: Reports claim India influenced Sri Lanka Presidential elections; govt denies
145.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo on Wednesday tweeted, "We have seen baseless and purely speculative media reports about efforts at political level from India to influence...elections in Sri Lankan Parliament to the post of President." "We categorically deny these media reports as completely false. They are clearly a figment of someone's imagination," it wrote.

146.title: Hardik can make it to any team for Tests purely as a batter: Nehra
146.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said all-rounder Hardik Pandya can make it to any team in Test matches purely as a batter. Virat Kohli had earlier said that Hardik will need to bowl in Tests. "[I don't see] Hardik bowling 15 to 18 overs a day...He's far away from getting into the red-ball circuit," ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer had stated.

147.title: Hoist tricolour at homes to prove you're genuine children of 'Bharat Mata': Assam CM
147.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma asked all residents to hoist the tricolour between August 13 and 15 at their houses in order to prove that they are "genuine children of Bharat Mata". "Applying for NRC to say that you are Indian citizens is not enough. You have to give proof…Is it or not?" Sarma asked at an event on Tuesday.

148.title: US House passes bill to protect same-sex & interracial marriages
148.article_body: The US House of Representatives on Tuesday voted 267-157 to pass a bill protecting same-sex and interracial marriages under federal law. Forty-seven Republicans joined all Democrats in voting in favour of the bill. This comes amid concerns that the recent Supreme Court ruling ending abortion rights could endanger other precedents. The bill will now go to US Senate for vote.

149.title: Cruel to raise tax rates when CPI inflation is over 7%: Jairam Ramesh
149.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that it is cruel to raise tax rates when CPI inflation is over 7%. "It is cruel…WPI inflation is over 15%, unemployment is high, the rupee is depreciating, the current account deficit is widening and inflation is expected to rise worldwide," he stated in a thread of tweets.

150.title: Electoral offences committed by Prez candidate Murmu: Congress to EC
150.article_body: The Congress party has alleged violation of provisions of the law by NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in the July 18 election and has filed a complaint with the Election Commission (EC) regarding it. The Karnataka Congress claimed that the BJP "bribed and exerted undue influence" on its MLAs on July 17 and 18 asking them to vote for Murmu.

151.title: Order that prohibited restaurants from levying service charge stayed by Delhi HC
151.article_body: Delhi High Court on Wednesday stayed the guidelines to prohibit restaurants from levying service charges that were issued by Central Consumer Protection Authority till next court hearing on November 25. It, however, stated eateries must prominently display that they levy service charge. National Restaurant Association of India had earlier moved the court against the guidelines.

152.title: 347 sanitation workers died across India in last 5 years: Govt data
152.article_body: At least 347 sanitation workers died across India in the last five years, the Centre informed Lok Sabha on Tuesday. While Uttar Pradesh saw the highest number of deaths at 51, Tamil Nadu and Delhi stood at 48 and 44, respectively. In these years, 2019 saw the highest number of deaths at 116, followed by 92 deaths in 2017.

153.title: Chinese media doesn’t even mention ‘talks’: Chidambaram after 16th round of talks
153.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Wednesday said that the 16th round of talks between India and China on the "border disputes" ended, as expected, without an agreement. "While Indian media reports 'no breakthrough in talks', Chinese media does not even mention the talks," Chidambaram tweeted. "China has conceded nothing on 'Hot Springs'," he added.

154.title: No disqualification of MLAs yet, issue may require a 5-judge bench: SC on Shiv Sena crisis
154.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday said that the issues involved in the petitions over the Shiv Sena crisis might require to be referred to a five-judge bench for consideration. The Speaker will maintain the status quo and not decide on any disqualification of rebel MLAs, SC added. It also directed the Legislative Assembly secretary to keep all records in safe custody.

155.title: 21-yr-old US vlogger gang-raped by 2 men at hotel in Pakistan
155.article_body: A 21-year-old US vlogger was allegedly gang-raped by two men at a hotel in Punjab province of Pakistan, police said on Tuesday. "The suspects gang-raped me and also made a video of the act to blackmail me," she alleged in the FIR. Police has already arrested one of the two suspects and is conducting raids to arrest the other.

156.title: Mann criticises Centre for not giving representation to Punjab in MSP panel
156.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has criticised Centre for not giving the state a representation in the panel formed on minimum support price (MSP). "Punjab's farmers are...stuck in crop cycle and debt. MSP is our legal right," he said. Besides members of agricultural universities and central government secretaries, the panel also includes chief secretaries of Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim and Odisha.

157.title: Delhiites to receive 'opt-in' forms for subsidy with electricity bills from Aug
157.article_body: The Delhi government will send out 'opt-in' forms to consumers along with their electricity bills from August that will require them to state whether they want to avail power subsidy or not, according to officials. Consumers will have to submit the forms at the zonal offices of their respective discoms if they wish to avail the subsidy, the officials added.

158.title: Flipkart announces The Zero Hour live sale for Nothing Phone (1)
158.article_body: Flipkart shared that it's back again with one of the most awaited global launches of the year. It has announced the first-ever live sale of Nothing Phone (1) on July 21, 7 PM. The event will be hosted by Gaurav Kapur with Rajiv Makhani, Masaba Gupta, Manushi Chillar, and Jim Sarbh sharing their views on the phone on Flipkart Live.

159.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe elected as new President of Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
159.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Sri Lanka, Ranil Wickremesinghe was on Wednesday elected as the new President of the country. This comes after Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who fled the country along with his wife, resigned from the post. Sri Lanka is effectively bankrupt and facing acute shortages of food, fuel and other basic supplies.

160.title: I don't know where we are going: Kamran Akmal on Pakistan cricket
160.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal said he "doesn't know" where Pakistan cricket is going, considering entry to high-performance training camps being denied to players, who have represented the nation in 100-150 matches. "Can they stop Wasim Akram, Shoaib Akhtar...?...[PCB Chairman] Ramiz Raja used to come...years after retiring from the game. Can [they]...dare to stop him now?" added Kamran.

161.title: 1,000 passenger complaints received against Air India in 3 months: Govt
161.article_body: Around 1,000 passenger complaints have been received against Air India during the last three months, MoS for Civil Aviation VK Singh said. Furthermore, he said, the complaints were related to staff behaviour, refund of fares and overbooking of flights among others. "Ministry of Civil Aviation has been receiving grievances related to air transport, including Air India," Singh stated.

162.title: Govt releases rules for Work from Home for Special Economic Zones
162.article_body: The Ministry of Commerce & Industry has released rules for Work from Home for Special Economic Zones. "WFH allowed for a maximum period of one-year; may be extended to maximum 50% of total employees including contractual employees," it said. "Development Commissioners of SEZs empowered to extend it beyond one-year and for more than 50% of total employees," the ministry added.

163.title: Video shows TN minister angry as journalist questions him for being late
163.article_body: A video showing Tamil Nadu Rural Development Minister KR Periakaruppan furious after a journalist questioned him about arriving late at an event has gone viral. Periakaruppan reportedly was a few hours late. When a journalist confronted him, he said, "Who waited for three hours? Who gave such an interview? Who waited inside?" He then approached the person recording the video.

164.title: 554 sq km forest land diverted for non-forestry purposes in last 3 yrs: Govt
164.article_body: About 554.3 square kilometres of forest land in the country has been diverted for non-forestry purposes in last three years, government informed the Lok Sabha on Monday. According to data presented by Union Minister of State (MoS) for Environment Ashwini Kumar Choubey, mining accounted for maximum diversion of 112.78 square kilometres of land, followed by road construction.

165.title: Delhi HC to hear all pleas challenging Agnipath scheme on August 25
165.article_body: Delhi High Court will hear all the pleas challenging the Centre's Agnipath recruitment scheme on August 25. This comes after Supreme Court transferred three petitions challenging the scheme to Delhi HC. SC asked Kerala, Punjab and Haryana, Patna and Uttarakhand High Courts to transfer all petitions to Delhi HC or keep them pending till a decision comes from Delhi HC.

166.title: It is going to be a tough 2022 and possibly an even tougher 2023: IMF chief
166.article_body: In a blog on global economy, International Monetary Fund chief Kristalina Georgieva, wrote, "It's going to be a tough 2022—and possibly an even tougher 2023, with increased risk of recession." "Inflation is higher than expected and has broadened beyond food and energy prices," Georgieva said, adding, "We'll be projecting a further downgrade to global growth for both 2022 and 2023."

167.title: If we challenge India's match-winners, it'll be a message to the world: Pooran
167.article_body: West Indies white-ball captain Nicholas Pooran has said he wants to send a message to the cricketing world by challenging India's match-winners in their upcoming series. On his side's current form in ODI cricket, Pooran said, "We're trying to find out the right mindset for ODI cricket." West Indies recently lost three-match ODI series at home against Bangladesh.

168.title: Dad Rishi Kapoor called my film choices 'nonsense': Ranbir Kapoor
168.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed his late father Rishi Kapoor wasn't happy with his film choices and added his father was happy when Ranbir joined 'Shamshera'. As per Rishi, Ranbir's film choices were "bakwaas (nonsense)" and didn't feature in films for the masses. "Unfortunately, he hadn't seen the trailer or poster of 'Shamshera', but I know...he's somewhere out there, proud," Ranbir added.

169.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from July 20-22
169.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power outages on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday (July 20-22) as BESCOM is carrying out maintenance and repair works. Most of these works will be done between 10 am and 5.30 pm. The areas that will be affected today include Hondada Circle, Harakanalu etc. While areas that will face power cuts tomorrow include Talagavara, Cheemangala etc.

170.title: Australia cricketer Adam Zampa takes T20 World Cup 2022 trophy underwater, pics surface
170.article_body: During the T20 World Cup 2022 Trophy Tour, Australia leg-spinner Adam Zampa took the trophy underwater at the Great Barrier Reef. "It’s a privilege to be able to bring the World Cup trophy to this precious place and encourage fans around the world to get to Australia later this year," Zampa said. The tournament will commence in Australia in October.

171.title: I'm struggling, need another operation: Wood on injury he suffered in March
171.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood, who has been out of the England squad since suffering an elbow injury against West Indies in March, has revealed that he needs another operation on his elbow. "I'm struggling to be honest...I'm struggling to fully straighten it," stated Wood. "I've got to get it sorted...if I want to be fit for T20 WC," he added.

172.title: Play with 'Koi nahi hai takkar mai, kahan pade ho chakkar mai' mantra: PM to CWG athletes
172.article_body: While interacting with athletes who will represent India at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, PM Narendra Modi said, "Play with 'Kohi nahi hai takkar mai, kahan pade ho chakkar mai' mantra." "Play well with all your strengths, without stress," PM Modi added. CWG 2022 will take place in Birmingham and will begin on July 28.

173.title: Tourist video shows explosion at Hoover Dam in US
173.article_body: A video shot by a tourist showed an explosion and fire at the Hoover Dam, one of the largest hydroelectric facilities in US' Nevada, on Tuesday. "My goodness, something has just blown up," a person can be heard saying in the video. A thick cloud of black smoke and flames could be seen rising from the structure.
