174.title: Rahul always disrespected Parliamentary proceedings: Smriti Irani
174.article_body: BJP MP Smriti Irani criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi by saying that he is adamant to bring down the productivity of Lok Sabha. Referring to Rahul Gandhi, she said, "The person who's been politically unproductive is dedicating himself to ensure there's no debate in Parliament." Rahul's entire political history has been dotted with showing disrespect to Parliamentary procedure, she added.

175.title: Punjab Police responds to man who said he was beaten over 'I like you' message to woman
175.article_body: Punjab Police has responded to a man who said he was beaten by a woman's husband after he sent her a message that read "I like you". "Not sure what you were expecting on your unwarranted message to a woman...They should have reported you to us and we would have served you right under right sections of law," police replied.

176.title: Old pic showing 8-yr-old Naomi Osaka watching Nadal play at US Open goes viral
176.article_body: An old picture showing 8-year-old Naomi Osaka watching Rafael Nadal play at the US Open has gone viral on social media. Osaka, now 24, won the US Open in 2018 and 2020. Reacting to the picture that was shared by a user on Twitter, users wrote, "What a moment in time captured," and "Omggggggg this picture is iconic."

177.title: The man I know would never tweet in Hindi: Sudeep on debate with Ajay
177.article_body: Discussing his national language debate on Twitter with Ajay Devgn, Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeep said, "I am...sure the man I know would never tweet in Hindi." "It's definitely a third person's idea," added Sudeep. "If Hindi is not our national language then why do you release your mother tongue movies by dubbing them in Hindi?" Ajay had tweeted in Hindi.

178.title: 14-yr-old girl attacked, molested inside stationary train in Mumbai
178.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was reportedly molested inside a stationary train at Mumbai's Lower Parel railway station. The accused allegedly tricked the girl who had run away from home in Santacruz after a fight and took her to the train, where he sexually assaulted her and attacked her with a blade. She escaped and later filed an FIR with her parents.

179.title: It might well be that IPL is a beneficiary: Scott Styris on Stokes' ODI retirement
179.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris has said Ben Stokes' ODI retirement might be beneficial for the IPL as the England all-rounder might play in the tournament. Stokes had pulled out of IPL 2022 to focus on Test cricket. Styris further said the ODI format is "not in trouble" given "how big" the ODI World Cup was in 2019.

180.title: Australians urged to work from home as COVID hospitalisations rise
180.article_body: Authorities in Australia have urged businesses to let staff work from home as people admitted to hospitals from COVID-19 neared record levels on Wednesday. Authorities also recommended people wear masks indoors and get booster shots urgently. Australia, which is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to BA.4 and BA.5 Omicron subvariants, has recorded over 3,00,000 cases over the past seven days.

181.title: Russia laying groundwork to annex more of Ukraine: US
181.article_body: Russia is "laying the groundwork" to annex more Ukrainian territory following a similar "playbook" it used to seize Crimea in 2014, US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said. The steps Russia is planning may include "sham" referenda, installing illegitimate proxy officials, establishing the rouble as official currency and forcing Ukrainians to apply for Russian citizenship, he added.

182.title: Onus on govt to ensure smooth functioning of House: Congress leader
182.article_body: As the Opposition has been protesting against inflation, price rise and other issues, Congress leader Shaktisinh Gohil said the onus is on government to ensure smooth functioning of the House. "When BJP was in Opposition, late Arun Jaitley and their other leaders used to say that it was the responsibility of the government…So, the onus is on government," he added.

183.title: Kerala won't impose GST on essential items sold by small stores: Minister
183.article_body: Kerala government on Tuesday said that it would not impose GST on items sold by organisations like Kudumbashree or small stores in 1 or 2-kilogram packets or in loose quantities. The decision might lead to issues with the Centre, state Finance Minister KN Balagopal said. "Yesterday too, CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to the Centre regarding these things," he added.

184.title: Don't agree with press freedom index, methodology questionable: Govt
184.article_body: The Indian government said that it does not agree with the World Press Freedom Index published by international organisation Reporters Without Borders and questioned the methodology used in the assessment. "The government...does not agree to the conclusions...for various reasons including very low sample size, little or no weightage to fundamentals of democracy," Union Minister Anurag Thakur said.

185.title: India reports 20,557 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,45,654
185.article_body: India has reported 20,557 COVID-19 cases and 40 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. With 18,517 COVID-19 patients discharged in 24 hours, the active cases now stand at 1,45,654. The total death toll in India has risen to 5,25,825. This comes a day after India reported 15,528 new cases.

186.title: BBMP to fine landlords who allow garbage to be dumped on vacant plots
186.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has asked public to maintain cleanliness at vacant sites in Bengaluru's RR Nagar. In its order, the civic body asked owners to clear garbage and construction waste dumped on their plots, failing which fines of up to ₹1 lakh would be imposed on them. The order was issued following complaints from residents.

187.title: Team India arrive in Trinidad for white-ball series vs WI
187.article_body: Team India arrived in Trinidad on Wednesday ahead of their white-ball series, which is scheduled to begin on Friday. India will play a three-match ODI series between July 22 to July 27 and five-match T20I series beginning on July 29. Senior players including Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested, with Shikhar Dhawan captaining in ODIs.

188.title: Inclination towards radical ideologies in India minuscule: Govt
188.article_body: The government said that some foreign agencies inimical to India along with global terrorist groups have been making efforts to radicalise people but “inclination towards radical ideologies is minuscule”, compared to India's population. "Radicalisation by global terrorist groups like ISIS, al-Qaeda etc. is one of the most challenging problems faced by countries," MoS Home Nityanand Rai said.

189.title: Someone else in place of Kohli would've been dropped by now: Kirmani
189.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's run drought, former India wicketkeeper Syed Kirmani said, "Had it been someone else in place of Virat, he would've been dropped...by now." Kapil Dev earlier suggested that Kohli should be dropped from India's T20I side considering his performances with the bat. "If he isn't performing...you can't keep the performing youngsters out of the team," he had stated.

190.title: Indian embassy in SL shares pic of injured official; issues advisory for Indian nationals
190.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo has shared a picture of an official who "sustained grievous injuries in an unprovoked assault". It released an advisory amid the economic crisis in the country, saying, "Indian nationals in Sri Lanka are requested to remain aware of latest developments and accordingly plan their movements and activities. You may contact us when required."

191.title: List of world's most powerful passports released; India ranks 87th
191.article_body: Japan's passport has been named the most powerful in the world with its citizens having visa-free access to 193 countries, according to the Henley Passport Index. Singapore and South Korea have been ranked second, Germany and Spain third and Finland, Italy and Luxembourg fourth. The Indian passport has secured the 87th rank, with visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to 60 destinations.

192.title: Truck runs over father, daughter after duo falls off bike in Pune
192.article_body: A 35-year-old man and his 10-year-old daughter died after a truck ran over them on the Hadapsar Saswad Road on Tuesday morning. "Primary probe suggests that the father-daughter duo fell on the road after the bike slipped," police said. The incident took place when the man was dropping his daughter at her school. The truck driver has been detained.

193.title: Jackie Chan opened doors for me in H'wood, he's like older brother: Mallika
193.article_body: Talking about Jackie Chan, Mallika Sherawat said, "Jackie Chan is like an older brother to me....He opened all the doors for me in Hollywood." She added Jackie helped her settle in Hollywood after things went bad for her in Bollywood. "Jackie said...'You just land there in LA and you'll get the red carpet treatment', and I did," she stated.

194.title: SC sends notice to NIA on Varavara Rao's bail plea in Bhima-Koregaon case
194.article_body: Supreme Court sent a notice to the National Investigation Agency (NIA) on a plea seeking permanent medical bail filed by activist Varavara Rao in the Bhima-Koregaon case. The court asked NIA to file its counter-affidavit by August 2. SC posted the case for a final hearing on August 10. It had earlier extended the interim bail granted to Rao.

195.title: Will act on demand for Maratha reservation as per Constitution: Bommai
195.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the state government will act on the demand for Maratha reservation within the provisions of the Constitution. "The state government is considering the proposal. Action would be initiated...after getting...report from the Backward Classes Commission," he said while addressing a function to inaugurate the Maratha Communities Development Corporation.

196.title: Traitors left party but original Sena workers still with us: Aaditya Thackeray
196.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that "traitors" have left the party but the original workers are still with them. "This rebellion has unmasked their hatred, jealousy and anger against us. The truth is thus coming out," Aaditya added. "It also means everyone of them used to lie when they claimed to have respect towards the Thackeray family," he stated.

197.title: Water supply to be hit in Thane's Naupada-Kopari area from July 20-22
197.article_body: There will be no water supply in Thane's Naupada-Kopari area on Wednesday, Thursday (July 20-21) and water will be supplied at low pressure on Friday (July 22), officials said. The supply will remain hit due to work on the connection of the newly installed down-take pipe at Kanhaiya Nagar water reservoir in Kopari with the main distribution channel.

198.title: England debutant Potts leaves field after bowling just 4 overs over record-breaking heat
198.article_body: England's 23-year-old debutant Matthew Potts left the field after bowling just four overs in the first ODI against South Africa at the Riverside Ground in Chester-le-Street due to record-breaking heat. Potts was seen sitting in the changing room and rehydrated with a fan on his face. Temperatures at Chester-le-Street hit a record 39°C on Tuesday.

199.title: Extremely heavy to very heavy rainfall warning in several states; list released
199.article_body: IMD has predicted extremely heavy to very heavy rainfall in Uttarakhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya between July 20 to 23. Meanwhile, isolated very heavy rainfall is also likely over Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, Chandigarh, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim, Odisha and East Madhya Pradesh between July 20 and 23.

200.title: Bill Gates congratulates PM Modi as India crosses 2 billion COVID-19 vaccinations
200.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi as India crossed 2 billion COVID-19 vaccinations. "Congratulations @narendramodi for yet another milestone of administering #200crorevaccinations. We are grateful for our continued partnership with Indian vaccine manufacturers and the Indian government for mitigating the impact of COVID-19," Gates tweeted.

201.title: Female sub-inspector mowed down to death during vehicle check in Jharkhand
201.article_body: A female sub-inspector named Sandhya Topno died after she was mowed down by a vehicle during vehicle check in Jharkhand on Tuesday night. "She was posted as in-charge of Tupudana OP. The accused has been arrested, and the vehicle has been seized," Ranchi SSP said. Earlier, a DSP was run over by a truck by mining mafia in Haryana.

202.title: Cried my heart out, every Indian should watch it: Anupam on 'Rocketry...'
202.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher posted a video on Instagram, in which he spoke about R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. In the video, Anupam said, "Thank you Madhavan for making such a brilliant film. If the film can inspire me, it will surely inspire today's generation." He captioned the post, "Cried my heart out. Every Indian should watch it!"

203.title: Mild tremors in Pune's Mulshi, GSI to inspect dam area
203.article_body: Areas around Mulshi dam in Pune on Tuesday reportedly witnessed mild tremors. In a letter, Tata Power clarified that the tremors might be due to controlled explosions or landslides, not earthquakes. District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has said a team of the Geological Survey of India (GSI) will visit the site to inspect the tremors and investigate the reason behind it.

204.title: I am done being the 'Harry Potter' of Bollywood: Actor Ranbir Kapoor
204.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he is done being the "Harry Potter" of Bollywood. "I've done the coming of age [films], I have come off age," added Ranbir. Discussing his upcoming film 'Shamshera', Ranbir had said, "It was extremely hard. There were many days when I had given up...I used to go home and speak to Alia Bhatt about it."

205.title: 2 men steal diamonds worth ₹3.5 cr, replace them with fake ones in Mumbai
205.article_body: Two men were booked for allegedly stealing diamonds worth ₹3.5 crore from a jeweller's office in diamond bourse at Mumbai's Bandra-Kurla Complex. The accused reportedly visited the jeweller's office to buy diamonds. They selected a few and, with sleight of hand, replaced them with duplicates and left. Later, when the jeweller realised the diamonds were fake, he filed an FIR.

206.title: It should definitely be a wake-up call: Buttler on Stokes' ODI retirement
206.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said Ben Stokes' ODI retirement should be a "wake-up call" in terms of managing the workload of players. "There's a bit of sadness...But our loss in ODI cricket is certainly going to be England's gain in Test cricket," added Buttler. Stokes announced ODI retirement stating that playing all three formats is "unsustainable" for him.

207.title: India blocked 78 YouTube-based news channels in 2021-2022: Govt
207.article_body: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting issued directions for blocking 78 YouTube-based news channels and their social media accounts for public access during 2021 and 2022 for violation of Section 69A of the IT Act, 2000, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said. "The MeitY has blocked 560 YouTube URLs during the years 2021 and 2022," he told the Lok Sabha.

208.title: Owaisi accuses Centre of 'politicising' all-party meet on Sri Lanka crisis
208.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi accused Centre of politicising the all-party meeting on Sri Lanka crisis and by raising "unrelated issues" about finances of Indian states. "Dr S Jaishankar...said that there's a 'misinformed campaign and comparison between India and Sri Lanka'. If so, why did the Department of Economic Affairs have to make a presentation?" he asked in a Twitter thread.

209.title: India records 36,29,537 cyber security incidents since 2019 till June 2022: Govt
209.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Kumar Mishra told the Lok Sabha that India recorded 36,29,537 cases related to cyber security since 2019 till June this year. A total of 3,94,499 cyber security incidents in 2019, 11,58,208 in 2020, 14,02,809 in 2021 and 6,74,021 incidents were observed in 2022, upto June, Mishra informed the Lok Sabha.

210.title: My producers tell me 'You double our money in 25 days': Kartik Aaryan
210.article_body: Following the success of his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', actor Kartik Aaryan said, "My producers told me recently, 'You're...an actor who doubles our money in 25 days'." Discussing his struggling days in Bollywood, Kartik stated, "[My] first car...was...a third-hand car...I got it with great difficulty...I took it specifically because I was still taking an auto to the red carpet."

211.title: Producers have star kids to launch, don't know if we'll get chance: Prince
211.article_body: Prince Narula, speaking about his chance in Bollywood, has said, "They (producers) have...many star kids to launch that we don't know if we will ever get a chance." "Even if we get a role, it'll be...some other (side) role," he added. Prince stated that while getting into Bollywood is hard, people's perception has changed after Sushant Singh Rajput's death.

212.title: Police spend 3 nights at a Mumbai station to arrest serial bag lifter
212.article_body: A team of 15 officials from the Government Railway Police (GRP), posing as passengers, spent three consecutive nights at Mumbai's Andheri Railway Station to catch a serial bag lifter. The accused was arrested after he stole a bag belonging to a police inspector of Andheri GRP. The inspector said that they received over 10 complaints from commuters in a month.

213.title: 300% growth in enrolment for Executive MBA program: SP Jain Global
213.article_body: The SP Jain Executive MBA is a global program which aims to transform managers into powerful leaders of tomorrow. The flexible 18-month program is taught by international faculty, has a diverse student body with 16 years of average work experience, includes opportunities to network via newly-introduced global immersion weeks in Singapore and Dubai, and results in an Australian degree.

214.title: 41-yr-old professor kills self in Bengaluru, cites health reasons
214.article_body: A 41-year-old professor was found dead at her residence in West Bengaluru on Monday. According to reports, the deceased, identified as Chaitra HK, used to teach at an engineering college. She reportedly killed herself when her husband and children were away visiting a relative's house. In a purported suicide note, Chaitra cited health issues as a reason behind the step.

215.title: Netflix loses nearly 1 million subscribers in 2nd quarter; share price rises
215.article_body: Netflix has said in its earnings report that it lost 970,000 subscribers in the second quarter, which was less than two million it forecast during its first quarter report in April. After Netflix lost 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter, its shares fell around 67% this year. However, the shares rose 7% to $216 in after-hours trading following latest results.

216.title: Told them to get lost: Mallika Sherawat on being offered 'Jalebi Baby'
216.article_body: Actress Mallika Sherawat revealed she was offered Tesher and Jason Derulo's song 'Jalebi Baby'. "They called me...asked me if I can do this song...I told them, don't call...and get lost. I cut the call then," she stated. Mallika added she was called 'Jalebi Baby' on the US streets and that's when her manager told her the song was a hit.

217.title: Senior citizen loses ₹6.07 lakh in sextortion trap in Mumbai
217.article_body: A Mumbai-based senior citizen ended up losing ₹6.07 lakh in sextortion wherein he was allegedly induced to indulge in nudity by an unknown woman over a video call. Later, he received a call from a person claiming to be a Delhi Police personnel who told him that he had come across his obscene video and demanded money for helping him.

218.title: Pune Metro line to be extended from Garware College to Civil Court
218.article_body: Pune Metro Rail said it is soon going to extend the metro line from Garware College to Civil Court. "The elevated line from Vanaz Station to Civil Court Station will be completed shortly," it added. "It'll take some time to complete the work on Deccan Station, Chhatrapati Sambhaji Station, PMC Station and Civil Court Station on this route," it stated.

219.title: Elon Musk reacts after social media user compares his shirtless pic with a dog
219.article_body: Elon Musk has reacted after a Twitter user compared the Tesla CEO's shirtless picture with a dog. "My calves are bigger tho," Musk commented on the post. Musk's shirtless pictures from his trip to Greece had gone viral on social media. "Maybe I should take off my shirt more often," he had said while responding to the pictures.

220.title: Hyderabad fireman dies by suicide over harassment from loan agents
220.article_body: A 33-year-old fireman allegedly died by suicide in Hyderabad after being harassed over repayment of borrowed money by organisers of online loan apps. The fireman's body was found on the tracks near a railway station on Tuesday. According to police, the deceased had taken loans from instant loan apps, but was unable to repay them due to some financial problems.

221.title: Gang offering loan under govt scheme at discounted rates busted in Delhi
221.article_body: Delhi Police busted a loan fraud gang in Rohini and arrested seven persons, including five women. The accused cheated more than 150 people in one year by offering them loans under the Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana at discounted rates. This comes after a complainant claimed that he had received a message stating he could get a loan of ₹2 lakh.

222.title: Kareena denies pregnancy rumours, says 'Saif has contributed way too much to population'
222.article_body: Kareena Kapoor took to Instagram to deny the rumours claiming she's pregnant for the third time after a picture of her and Saif Ali Khan from their Europe vacation went viral. "It's the pasta and wine guys...calm down...I am not pregnant.. uff...Saif says he has already contributed way too much to the population of our country...enjoy...KKK," she wrote on Instagram.

223.title: 2 Russians, 1 local arrested on drug charges in Himachal's Kullu
223.article_body: Two Russian nationals and a local were arrested in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district on Monday on drug-related charges. According to officials, the accused Russians were to receive a consignment of 116-gram 'charas' from Naggar resident Anup Sharma. The drugs were recovered from Sharma's possession, police informed. Both the Russians are permanent residents of Saint Petersburg, police added.

224.title: Mizoram logged 280 COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, highest in 4 months
224.article_body: Mizoram recorded the highest single-day spike in its COVID-19 tally in four months on Tuesday with 280 fresh cases, according to government statistics. Earlier on March 22, the state had reported 287 new cases. According to an official, Mizoram's daily positivity rate jumped from 26.89% on Monday to 27.72% on Tuesday. The state recorded 57 new cases on Monday.

225.title: Strikes on Syria will destabilise Middle East: Iran to Turkey
225.article_body: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Tuesday reportedly told Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan that further military strikes on Syria would destabilise the Middle East. According to Iranian state media, Khamenei also said that strikes on Syria "will benefit terrorists". Turkey has vowed to launch military operations to extend 30-km deep "safe zones" along its border with Syria.

226.title: Delhi-bound flight rejected take-off due to dog on runway in Leh
226.article_body: A flight was rejected take-off from Leh due to a dog on the runway, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said on Tuesday. Go First aircraft VT-WJJ was a Delhi-bound flight, the DGCA added. The DGCA also mentioned that it has conducted several spot checks after reports of increased engineering-related occurrences in scheduled airlines.

227.title: NIA raids 3 Andhra locations in Chhattisgarh Naxal encounter case
227.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted searches in three locations in Andhra Pradesh over the encounter between Chhattisgarh security forces and Naxals last year. The searches were conducted in Vijaywada and Prakasham districts and the NIA seized digital devices and documents including posters, banners, Naxal literature and diaries. In the encounter, 6 Naxals and 1 civilian were killed.

228.title: Rajasthan government dedicated to the youth: CM Ashok Gehlot
228.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said that state government is dedicated to the youth of the state. While laying the foundation stone of Jamnalal Bajaj Auditorium in Sikar via video conferencing, the CM referred to the various schemes of the state government aimed at the youth. Further, he added that 1.25 lakh government jobs have been provided to the youth.

229.title: France probes origins of wildfire, 1 detained
229.article_body: French investigators detained a 39-year-old man on Tuesday in connection with the suspected, deliberate lighting of forest fires in the country's southwest. The man was detained after reports that a vehicle was seen close to the spot where the fire originally started on July 12. Further, criminal investigators have found evidence pointing to possible arson.

230.title: Outgoing UK PM Boris Johnson chairs final Cabinet meeting
230.article_body: Outgoing UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson presided over his final Cabinet meeting on Tuesday where he defended his government's commitment to tackling climate change. "Who can doubt that we were right to be the first major economy to go for net zero," Johnson said at the meeting. Johnson was forced to resign after a number of scandals hit his party.

231.title: Constructive opposition always welcome in Parliament: Pralhad Joshi
231.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "Constructive opposition always welcome in Parliament," in response to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remark calling the Parliament 'unparliamentary'. Joshi tweeted, "There is no restriction on raising public issues in the Parliament, it was in 1975." Earlier today, the Parliament was adjourned as Opposition MPs raised slogans over inflation issues.

232.title: She borrowed mother's stole: Father of girl allegedly forced to remove bra at NEET centre
232.article_body: The father of a 17-year-old who claimed she was forced to remove her bra at a NEET exam centre in Kollam, Kerala said his daughter had to borrow his wife's stole to cover up. "I wanted to file a case so that no student faces such a plight in...future. It was heartbreaking to see my child so shaken," he stated.

233.title: Another fake IPL betting racket busted in UP's Hapur: Report
233.article_body: The UP Police has busted yet another international betting racket in Hapur that was functioning under the garb of an IPL tournament, a report said. The fake tournament, called 'Big Bash Punjab T20 League', was live streamed on YouTube with matches being played by local players. Russian associates of the organisers used an app called 'Cric Heroes' for placing bets.

234.title: Most parents in Pakistan don't allow their children to play cricket: Rauf
234.article_body: Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf revealed most parents in Pakistan don't allow their children to play cricket or any other sport and his parents also didn't allow him to play cricket initially. "But I continued playing...travelled to different cities for tape-ball cricket without telling my parents where I was going," he added. Rauf has taken 65 wickets in 48 international matches.

235.title: Centre flagged communal remarks on TV 163 times in last 3 year
235.article_body: The Centre flagged communally provocative remarks on TV channels on 163 instances in the last three years, Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur has said. In these cases, the government acted by the issuance of "advisories, warnings, apology scroll orders and off-air orders", Thakur said. He added the government has an institutional mechanism to take action in such situations.

236.title: Shortage of 1.35 lakh personnel in armed forces: Govt
236.article_body: The Centre has said there is a shortage of 1,35,784 personnel in the three armed forces with maximum vacancies in the Army at 1,16,464. The shortage includes soldiers and officers. The annual average recruitments in the Air Force, Navy and Army are 5,723, 5,332 and 60,000 respectively, Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt said.

237.title: K'taka HC denies bail to man who shared army base pics with Pak ISI
237.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has denied bail to Jeetendar Singh, who disguised himself as an Indian Army soldier and took photos of a naval base and shared them with Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence. Justice K Natarajan said the information could affect the sovereignty of India. He further added that if bail is granted, the petitioner could abscond and delay the case.

238.title: Rare twin giraffes born in Kenya, pics surface
238.article_body: Rare twin giraffes have been born at Nairobi National Park, Kenya's Wildlife and Tourism Cabinet Secretary Najib Balala said. "One of the Maasai giraffes has given birth to twins, this is an extremely rare occurrence. We welcome the newborns with love," he tweeted. According to experts, the twinning rate in giraffes is one in every 2,80,000.

239.title: India Women vs Pak Women to be one of the highlights of CWG 2022: CEO Reid
239.article_body: The match between India Women and Pakistan Women will be one of the "highlights" of the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, said Games CEO Ian Reid. "India and Pakistan will be close to capacity," he added. India will face Pakistan in their second match of Group A on July 31. Notably, women's cricket is making its debut at the Games.

240.title: It was Sharad Pawar who broke Shiv Sena into 2 factions: Ex-Maha MLA
240.article_body:
Former MLA Ramdas Kadam on Tuesday accused NCP chief Sharad Pawar of breaking Sena into two groups. "He was trying to end it since Balasaheb was there but never found a chance," he said. Sena was "systematically weakened" by Pawar, but Uddhav Thackeray wasn't willing to part ways with Pawar, he added.
more at ABP Live

241.title: MoHFW seeks report from Delhi hospital after woman gives birth on floor
241.article_body: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) sought a report from Delhi's Vardhman Mahavir Medical College and Safdarjung Hospital after a woman delivered her baby on the floor outside the hospital's emergency department on Tuesday. "Submit a detailed report within 48 hours on the above issue," the ministry said. The woman's family alleged that she was denied a maternity ward.

242.title: Turkey court upholds exit from key European treaty protecting women
242.article_body: A Turkish court ruled on Tuesday that President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan’s decision to pull Turkey out of a European treaty safeguarding women's rights against violence was lawful. Turkey withdrew from Council of Europe's Istanbul Convention in 2021, which drew criticism from rights groups. Over 200 women have reportedly been murdered in Turkey so far in 2022 due to gendered violence.

243.title: Twitter wins bid to fast-track trial over Musk's $44-bn deal, trial to be held in Oct
243.article_body: Twitter's lawsuit seeking to hold Elon Musk to his $44-billion takeover will go to trial in October, a judge ruled on Tuesday. This comes after Twitter won its motion for an expedited trial in its lawsuit against Musk. Twitter is seeking to enforce Musk's $44-billion acquisition of the company despite the Tesla CEO's intentions to back out of the deal.

244.title: Lyricist Jaani injured in accident in Punjab, pic of his overturned SUV surfaces
244.article_body: Renowned Punjabi lyricist and music composer Jaani Johan was hospitalised after being injured in a road accident in Mohali on Tuesday. As per reports, 33-year-old Jaani and two others were travelling in an SUV which hit another car and both vehicles flipped after the collision. A pic has shown the 'Pachtaoge' and 'Filhall' lyricist's SUV lying overturned on the road.

245.title: Woman sleepwalks through window in Germany, falls from 5th floor
245.article_body: An 18-year-old woman in Germany's Neubrandenburg was left critically injured as she fell onto the street after sleepwalking through an open window. The woman, who fell from fifth floor of the building, was found by a passerby who then called emergency services. The accident took place just after midnight when the victim was sleepwalking in the flat, preliminary probe found.

246.title: 819 armed forces' personnel died by suicide in last 5 years: Govt
246.article_body: As many as 819 armed forces personnel died by suicide in the last five years, Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt has said. Most numbers of suicides were reported in the Army with 642 cases. "For management of stress and suicides in services, the armed forces are continuously evolving measures to improve the stress mitigating mechanisms," Bhatt added.

247.title: Journalists Welfare Fund to be increased by ₹2 crore: U'khand CM
247.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said that Journalists Welfare Fund would be increased by ₹2 crore. The rules of the pension scheme for journalists must be simplified, he said, adding that monthly assistance given to veteran journalists has been increased from ₹5,000 to ₹8,000. Further, ₹36 lakh was approved from the fund for dependents of journalists and seriously ill journalists.

248.title: 7 persons from Sri Lanka reach Tamil Nadu, handed over to police
248.article_body: Seven persons from Sri Lanka were rescued off the coast of Tamil Nadu's Rameswaram by the Indian Coast Guard and handed over to the police on Tuesday. The rescued persons reportedly fled Sri Lanka to escape the ongoing economic crisis on the island nation. They were dropped by boatmen at the shoals near the island of Rameswaram.

249.title: DRDO signed 1,464 ‘transfer of tech’ agreements with firms so far
249.article_body: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has inked 1,464 'transfer of technology' agreements to date with Indian companies, MoS Defence Ajay Bhatt has said. The DRDO is working towards self-reliance in the defence sector, he said. The minister also said the government is looking to collaborate with a foreign engine company for the co-production of combat jet engines.

250.title: Putin arrives in Tehran for summit with Iranian, Turkish Presidents
250.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Tehran on Tuesday where he will hold talks with his Iranian counterpart Ebrahim Raisi and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. According to media reports, the trilateral summit will majorly focus on the current situation in Syria. Putin and Erdogan will also deliberate on the issue of Ukrainian grain exports through the Black Sea.

251.title: Russia will set the terms for peace in Ukraine: Medvedev
251.article_body: Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia Dmitry Medvedev on Tuesday said that peace will be established in Ukraine on Moscow's terms. Speaking about the conflict in eastern Europe, he also said, "Russia will achieve all its goals." Earlier, Medvedev had said that NATO and Ukraine's refusal to identify Crimea as part of Russia poses a "systemic threat".

252.title: Covered ourselves with hair after removing bra: Aspirant at Kerala NEET centre
252.article_body: A medical aspirant, one of the many allegedly forced to remove her bra at Kollam NEET exam centre, said, "While writing the exams, we had gone through mental trauma." "We had to cover ourselves with our hair as we didn't have a dupatta and we had to sit with male aspirants which too was indeed a harrowing experience," she added.

253.title: IIT-K incubated startup EndureAir Systems raises $1.7 mn in funding
253.article_body: EndureAir Systems, an IIT Kanpur incubated drone startup, said that it has raised $1.7 million in seed funding from Jalaj Dani, co-promoter of Asian Paints and founders of robotics and automation company Addverb Technologies. The drone startup, was founded in 2019 by IIT Kanpur professors Abhishek and Mangal Kothari, along with their students, Rama Krishna and Chirag Jain.

254.title: Girls were instructed to carry bras in hand on return: Aspirant at Kerala NEET centre
254.article_body: A medical aspirant, one of the many allegedly forced to remove her bra at Kollam NEET exam centre, said, "We were [told]...there'll be scanning...I was asked if I had a hook attached to my inner-wear." "What was even more concerning is that the official...instructed...girls to carry the inner-wear in their hands while returning and not wear it," the aspirant added.

255.title: I feel you had a lot more ODI fuel left, retired too soon: Yuvraj to Stokes
255.article_body: Conveying his best wishes to England all-rounder Ben Stokes following his announcement of ODI retirement, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Well done on a fabulous ODI career Stokes! A world-class all-rounder who's an asset for any side. Retired too soon!" He added, "I feel you had a lot more ODI fuel left in you." Stokes is playing in his last ODI today.

256.title: Neobanking startup Niyo raises $30 mn from private equity firm Multiples
256.article_body: Neobanking startup Niyo has raised $30 million from private equity firm Multiples Alternate Asset Management. The company raised $100 million in its Series C funding round in February 2022, led by Accel and Lightrock India. Niyo, founded in 2015 by Virender Bisht and Vinay Bagri, offers banking services in partnership with banks such as Yes Bank, ICICI Bank, among others.

257.title: Samyukta Kisan Morcha rejects govt's MSP committee
257.article_body: The Samyukta Kisan Morcha has rejected the government's committee on Minimum Support Price (MSP). The SKM objected to the presence of some members in the MSP committee, saying they had supported the three contentious farm laws repealed last year. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had repealed the farm laws and promised to form a committee to discuss a legal MSP guarantee.

258.title: Spanish man burnt by wildfire while trying to save town, critical
258.article_body: A man whose clothes caught fire amid a wildfire in Spain's Tabara on Monday has been admitted to the hospital and is critical. The man, Angel Martin Arjona, was trying to dig a trench in a field to stop the approaching fire from reaching his town when the blaze engulfed him. Arjona, who suffered severe burns, was airlifted to hospital.

259.title: 3 women who told girls to remove bras before NEET among 5 detained in Kerala
259.article_body: Kerala Police on Tuesday took five women into custody over complaints of girls being asked to remove their bras before appearing for the NEET medical entrance exam in Kollam. Three of the women were associated with the external agency deputed to frisk students at the exam centre, police said. Two women are staffers of the institute where NEET was held.

260.title: Mamata's nephew came to vote in Prez polls with convoy of cars: MLA
260.article_body: BJP MLA Sudip Mukherjee filed a complaint with Election Commission against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew, Abhishek Banerjee. Mukherjee claimed MP Abhishek brought a convoy of cars inside West Bengal Assembly premises when he came to vote in Presidential polls. According to rules of Presidential elections, MLAs/MPs can enter Assembly only with a car and a driver, Mukherjee said.

261.title: 37-year-old woman killed by a leopard in Uttarakhand's Pauri
261.article_body: A 37-year-old woman, Rina Devi, was killed by a leopard in Uttarakhand's Pauri district on Tuesday, officials said. Rina Devi was attacked while she was returning after dropping her son at his school in a nearby village, District Forest Officer Dinkar Tewari said. The woman's body was recovered from nearby bushes by the forest department, the official added.

262.title: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid features in Shikhar Dhawan's viral reel, fans react
262.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan, who'll lead India in ODI series against West Indies, shared a reel on Instagram which featured Team India head coach Rahul Dravid. Reacting to the viral reel, a fan wrote, "Dravid sir at end...These gen guys making him look so different." Another fan wrote, "Never thought we could ever see Rahul Dravid in a reel."

263.title: Man burnt alive by burglars in Bihar for resisting robbery attempt
263.article_body: A 34-year-old man was burnt alive by a group of unidentified persons for resisting a robbery attempt in Bihar's Munger. After being set on fire, the man ran into Munger's Dasharathpur railway station. Station officials and Railway Protection Force personnel took the victim to the hospital where he died during treatment. He is survived by his wife and two children.

264.title: Sri Lankan lawmakers to elect new President tomorrow
264.article_body: Sri Lankan lawmakers will elect the country's new President tomorrow (July 20). The candidates are Acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe, Sinhala Buddhist nationalist Dullas Alahapperuma and leftist leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake. Last week, Gotabaya Rajapaksa vacated the President's office, following public protests against his government's alleged mismanagement of the economy.

265.title: Fires erupt across UK as it records its hottest day ever, pics surface
265.article_body: The south of England and Wales saw multiple fires on Tuesday as temperatures in the UK breached the 40 degrees Celsius mark for the first time ever. London Fire Brigade declared a major incident as wildfires spread in several locations with houses going up in flames in some areas. Pictures showed huge plumes of smoke rising from homes and parks.

266.title: We are not cars where you can fill us up with petrol: Ben Stokes on ODI retirement
266.article_body: Talking about his decision to retire from ODIs, England Test captain Ben Stokes said, "We’re not cars where you can fill us up with petrol." The 31-year-old all-rounder added, "The schedule is jam-packed, and you’re asking a lot of the players to keep putting in 100% of their efforts every time you walk onto the field for your country."

267.title: Told him I wanted a CSK jersey not Team India one: Pakistan's Haris Rauf on meeting Dhoni
267.article_body: Recalling meeting MS Dhoni during the T20 World Cup 2021, Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf said, "I asked him to give me one of his shirts but I told him...I wanted a CSK jersey and not the Team India one." Rauf added, "He told me he'll surely send me that. I finally received it when I was in Australia."

268.title: Cong coming to power important than me becoming CM: DK Shivakumar
268.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Tuesday said that Congress coming to power is more important than him becoming the Chief Minister of Karnataka. "Only if the Congress party comes to power, the post of Chief Minister will be available," DK Shivakumar said. "The party high command will decide who should be the CM candidate," he added.

269.title: Stokes cares about everyone in England's dressing room: Teammate Wood
269.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood said teammate Ben Stokes, who announced his retirement from ODI cricket, is a "natural leader" and will be a big miss for the team. "Stokes is an alpha guy but he cares about everyone in that dressing room...wants to make sure that they are alright," he added. Stokes made his ODI debut in August 2011.

270.title: Albania, North Macedonia begin membership talks with EU
270.article_body: Albania and North Macedonia on Tuesday began talks with the European Union for membership. The EU's Executive Commission in 2018 had recommended membership negotiations start, but Germany, the Netherlands, France and finally Bulgaria held up the process with different demands. Albania and North Macedonia, which are NATO members, have received criticism for taking in migrants from outside the bloc.

271.title: 24-year-old man arrested with country-made pistol in Jammu
271.article_body: The police arrested a 24-year-old man with a country-made pistol in Jammu on Tuesday, officials said. The pistol was recovered from the man, named Akshay Kumar, during a routine check. Kumar runs a drug rehabilitation centre at Jammu's Gharota village in the name of Ayodhya foundation, the officials said.

272.title: Woman lynched in WB for alleged illicit relation with son-in-law
272.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was allegedly lynched by a mob in a village in West Bengal's Murshidabad district early on Tuesday for having an illicit relationship with her son-in-law, police said. The woman's 33-year-old son-in-law was also beaten up. Villagers had warned the man not to visit his mother-in-law when her husband was away for work.

273.title: ED arrests Jharkhand CM Soren's political aide in money laundering case
273.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren's political aide Pankaj Mishra was arrested by Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday in connection with an alleged money laundering case related to illegal mining. Mishra was taken to a Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court. ED had earlier said that it had seized ₹11.88 crore lying in 37 bank accounts belonging to Mishra and others.

274.title: I bought a third-hand car for ₹60,000 after first few films: Kartik Aaryan
274.article_body: Kartik Aaryan has said when he first joined Bollywood, he didn't have any car. "The first car...I bought was after a couple of films, a third-hand car...for around ₹60,000," he stated. "I took it specifically because I was still taking an auto to the red carpet, or going on a bike, or getting a lift," he added.

275.title: Healthcare startup PharmEasy plans $200 mn fundraising: Report
275.article_body: PharmEasy, a healthcare startup that provides medicines and medical services on its platform, is currently in talks with investors to raise $200 million but at a valuation 15%-25% lower than last year's $5.1 billion, according to reports. This could reduce PharmEasy's valuation for the funding round to $3.8 billion. Further, the company's IPO, targeted for this year, has been delayed.

276.title: Thank you: Shriver on Russia's Daria Kasatkina coming out as gay
276.article_body: After Russia's top-ranked singles player Daria Kasatkina came out as gay in a video interview posted online on Monday, former women's doubles world number one Pam Shriver took to Twitter and wrote, "Thank you!" World number 12 Kasatkina said she is dating Olympic medallist figure skater Natalia Zabiiako. Meanwhile, Kasatkina lost in first round of Hamburg European Open on Sunday.

277.title: 3 missing, 11 injured after gas explosion in China's Tianjin
277.article_body: At least 11 people were wounded and three were reported missing after a gas explosion in an apartment building in the Chinese city of Tianjin on Tuesday. The explosion took place during the early morning hours, Xinhua reported citing local authorities. The victims sustained non-life-threatening injuries, the local government said.

278.title: Met injured visa officer in Sri Lanka: Indian High Commission
278.article_body: Indian High Commission officials in Sri Lanka on Tuesday visited the Director of Indian Visa Centre Vivek Varma who sustained "grievous injuries" during an "unprovoked assault" on Monday night. According to the High Commission, the alleged assault took place near the capital city of Colombo. Local authorities have been informed about the matter, the High Commission added.

279.title: Acclaimed Iranian filmmaker jailed for 'anti-govt propaganda'
279.article_body: Acclaimed Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi has been ordered to serve a full six-year prison sentence, which was given to him in 2010 for 'anti-government propaganda'. Panahi was arrested earlier this month after he went to the prosecutor's office to enquire about his colleagues, who were also arrested by authorities amid a government crackdown. Panahi's films have won several international awards.

280.title: Hangzhou Asian Games, delayed due to COVID, rescheduled for September 2023
280.article_body: The postponed Asian Games will be held from September 23 to October 8 2023 in Hangzhou, the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) announced on Tuesday. The Games could not be hosted this year because of rising COVID-19 cases in China. The 19th Asian Games were originally planned to be held in Hangzhou from September 10-25 this year.

281.title: Govt shouldn't give security to those speaking against religion: BJP
281.article_body: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh on Tuesday said that some people make incorrect statements on religion and the country only to get security and urged the government to not give them any protection. He also said that suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma shouldn't get security just because she's a member of the ruling party.

282.title: 2-year-old boy drowns in a swimming pool in Lonavala, dies
282.article_body: Police said a two-year-old boy drowned in the swimming pool of a bungalow in Maharashtra's Lonavala, where his family had gathered to celebrate his second birthday. The incident took place on July 13 at the bungalow which the Nashik-based family had booked. "The parents...were busy on the first floor...when the toddler fell in the swimming pool," an official said.

283.title: ED arrests ex-Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey in NSE phone tapping case
283.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday arrested former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey in connection with a money laundering case linked to the alleged illegal phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees. The 1986-batch IPS officer retired from service on June 30. He has also served as the acting Maharashtra director general of police.

284.title: New pic taken by world's most powerful telescope shows purple galactic swirl in universe
284.article_body: A new picture taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, shows a purple galactic swirl in the universe. The image is of the centre of the spiral galaxy NGC 628. The image is a composite of three sets of data at different wavelengths taken by JWST’s mid-infrared instrument team.

285.title: Man dies by suicide after killing same-sex partner in MP's Betul
285.article_body: A 32-year-old man strangulated his partner to death before dying by suicide in MP's Betul when the latter threatened him of disclosing their homosexual relationship, police said on Tuesday. The accused's body was found on Saturday and his partner's body was recovered three days later, police added. The murder victim was in a relationship with other men, the probe found.

286.title: Rajasthan gangster wanted in 35 criminal cases held by Gujarat ATS
286.article_body: A Rajasthan-based gangster, Arvind Singh Bika, who was wanted in 35 criminal cases including murder, rioting and looting across three states was arrested by the Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS). Two pistols and live ammunition were recovered from him, police said. "He was often seen posting threatening videos on social media with him posing with weapons," an ATS official said.

287.title: Kalam was true representation of Indo-Islamic culture: Prez Kovind
287.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday said former President APJ Abdul Kalam was an ideal representation of Indo-Islamic culture. "He (Kalam) used to specially meet school children. He was sure that future generations will form the golden future of the country," President Kovind said. "I also believe that girls will have an important role in the country's development," he added.

288.title: Monkeypox testing has started at NIV Alappuzha: Kerala Minister
288.article_body: Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Tuesday said that the state has started monkeypox testing at National Institute of Virology (NIV) Alappuzha. "Kits have been brought to NIV Alappuzha from Pune...Testing samples in Kerala will reduce the time duration to get the result," Veena George said. This comes after Kerala confirmed the second case of monkeypox on Monday.

289.title: Red alert for heavy rain issued in 7 U'khand districts for tomorrow
289.article_body: India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for heavy rain in Dehradun, Tehri, Pauri, Nainital, Champawat, Udham Singh Nagar and Haridwar for Wednesday. The heavy rainfall could trigger more landslides in sensitive areas of the state. Travellers have been advised to avoid unnecessary journeys. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the disaster management authorities are on alert.

290.title: Sunak among final 3 contenders for UK PM, wins most support in latest voting round
290.article_body: Former British Chancellor Rishi Sunak is among the final three contenders for the post of British PM after lawmaker Kemi Badenoch was eliminated in the latest round of voting. Sunak won the most support from Conservative Party members of the British Parliament. Trade Minister Penny Mordaunt and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss are the other two candidates still in the race.

291.title: Rebel Sena MP is party's leader in Lok Sabha, says Maha CM Shinde
291.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has recognised rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale as the party's floor leader in the Lower House of Parliament. "Shiv Sena MPs too have supported us in our stand to uphold ideals of Balasaheb Thackeray," Shinde added, while speaking to mediapersons in Delhi.

292.title: Failure of entire govt machinery: Kejriwal on killing of Haryana DSP
292.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the killing of a DSP in Haryana was the result of the failure of the entire government machinery in the state. "How will the public be safe where the police is not safe?" he asked. The DSP investigating illegal stone-mining was killed on Tuesday when a truck drove into him, officials said.

293.title: PIL seeking my removal filed out of vendetta & vengeance: CBI chief
293.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) chief Subodh Jaiswal has told Bombay HC that public interest litigation (PIL) seeking his removal from the post has been filed out of "vendetta" and "vengeance". The PIL, which was filed by a retired police officer, stated that Jaiswal has doubtful credibility. Notably, the petitioner had also challenged Jaiswal's previous appointment as Maharashtra DGP.

294.title: Hindustan Unilever's net profit rises 14% YoY to ₹2,391 cr in Q1
294.article_body: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) on Tuesday reported a 13.85% YoY rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹2,391 crore for the March-June quarter. Its standalone net profit was at ₹2,191 crore. HUL's revenue from operations rose 19.46% YoY to ₹14,331 crore while its earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) margin was at 23.2% in Q1 FY23.

295.title: Qatar's Barshim wins 3rd straight high jump gold at World Championships
295.article_body: Tokyo Olympics gold medallist Mutaz Barshim of Qatar jumped a world-leading 2.37 metres to win high jump gold medal for the third successive time at World Athletics Championships in Oregon on Monday. South Korea's Sanghyeok Woo took silver (2.35 metres), while Ukraine's Andriy Protsenko won bronze (2.33 metres). Notably, 31-year-old Barshim went beyond his own season's best of 2.30 metres.

296.title: K'taka officials isolate co-passengers of India's 2nd monkeypox patient
296.article_body: Authorities in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district have isolated co-passengers of India's second monkeypox patient. The 31-year-old man from Kannur arrived at Mangalore International Airport (MIA) from Dubai on July 13. The District Surveillance Officer said as many as 191 passengers were in the aircraft along with him and 11 of them were from Dakshina Kannada.

297.title: Farmer files complaint against Lord Indra over lack of rains in UP, pic goes viral
297.article_body: A UP farmer submitted a written complaint to the local administration against the Hindu God of rain "Indra Devta (Bhagwan ji)", citing a lack of rainfall. A picture of the complaint filed by Sumit Kumar Yadav has gone viral. He wrote, "All are suffering...I, therefore, request you (District Magistrate) to take action against Indra Bhagwan."

298.title: I retired from ODIs due to horrendous schedule, ECB banned me from T20Is too: Pietersen
298.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to take a dig at the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB). "I once said the schedule was horrendous and I couldn’t cope, so I retired from ODI cricket & the ECB banned me from [T20Is] too," he tweeted. Pietersen's tweet comes after England Test captain Ben Stokes announced his retirement from ODIs.

299.title: Part of world's most powerful telescope permanently damaged by space rock: Report
299.article_body: Scientists have said part of James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful telescope, suffered permanent damage due to a series of micrometeorite strikes. The micrometeoroid which hit a segment in the period May 22-24 caused significant uncorrectable change in the overall figure of that segment, said scientists. The telescope was built at a cost of $10 billion.

300.title: Govt releases list of cities and towns renamed in the last 5 years
300.article_body: The Centre gave its nod for renaming seven cities and towns, including Allahabad to Prayagraj, in last five years, the Lok Sabha was informed. The approval was given to renaming of Rajahmundry (Rajamahendravaram), Nagar Untari (Shri Banshidhar Nagar), Birsinghpur Pali (Maa Birasini Dham), Hoshangabad Nagar (Narmadapuram), Babai (Makhan Nagar) and Shri Hargobindpur city (Shri Hargobindpur Sahib).

301.title: India on course to achieve 8-8.5% growth based on Q1 data: Govt
301.article_body: India is on course to achieve projected 8-8.5% growth based on high frequency indicators for the first quarter of FY23, the Finance Ministry said on Tuesday. Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the government has cut excise duty on petrol and diesel and special excise duty/cess on petrol, diesel and jet fuel exports to ensure continued growth momentum.

302.title: Huge sinkhole opens up in New York City, swallows van; video goes viral
302.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a huge sinkhole opening up in New York City. In the video, a van can be seen toppling into the sinkhole after heavy rains pounded the area. No injuries were reported in connection with the sinkhole, officials said. As per reports, 75 customers were left without water service because of the sinkhole.

303.title: Canada temple issues security measures after Gandhi statue defaced
303.article_body: The management of the Vishnu temple in Canada's Toronto has issued new security measures after a statue of Mahatma Gandhi situated there was defaced last week. Additional security cameras will be installed near the temple complex to monitor the surroundings, an official said. India had released a statement on the statue's desecration, terming the incident as a "hate crime".

304.title: Man stabs wife, her live-in partner to death in Bhopal; arrested
304.article_body: A man, Sunil Malviya, was arrested for stabbing his wife and her live-in partner to death in a market in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. Station in-charge Alok Srivastava said the victim, 22-year-old Aruna Malviya, was living separately with her 5-year-old daughter and 25-year-old Rajendra. Sunil tracked the timing of their return and attacked them on Monday evening, police added.

305.title: Police arrest 682 criminals under Operation Akraman in Haryana
305.article_body: Haryana Police arrested 682 criminals including proclaimed offenders, bail jumpers and confiscated illicit arms, liquor and narcotic substances under a special drive called Operation Akraman. DGP PK Agrawal said about 5,000 personnel in 616 teams raided locations following tip-offs. The aim was to check smuggling of weapons and eradicate drug menace in the state, police added.

306.title: Situation is exceptional but comparing it with India is ignorant: Jaishankar on Lanka
306.article_body: The government hosted an all-party meeting on Sri Lanka crisis on Tuesday, during which External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar briefed the attendees, including opposition MPs. "The situation is unprecedented and India is worried about it. But drawing comparisons (with India) is uninformed," said Jaishankar. The opposition has raised concerns about India's economy in the wake of Lankan crisis.

307.title: Russia seeks explanation from India over detained cargo ship in Cochin
307.article_body: Russian Embassy in India has said it's aware of the Russian cargo ship detention in Cochin, on board which military cargo for Indian Armed Forces was delivered. The embassy has filed an official request for an explanation of the incident's circumstances. "We've also asked...MEA to ensure unconditional observance of...rights of...Russian shipowners and crew," it said.

308.title: State taking all precautions against monkeypox: TN Health Minister
308.article_body: Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian said the state is taking all precautions to prevent the spread of monkeypox and is monitoring those coming from abroad at four international airports in the state. Wards and sufficient number of beds have been allocated to deal with any possible cases of monkeypox that may be reported in the coming days, Subramanian added.

309.title: KCR dedicated to eradicating poverty in Telangana: Minister
309.article_body: Telangana Minority Welfare Minister Koppula Eshwar said CM K Chandrashekar Rao is dedicated to eradicating poverty among minorities in the state. A number of gurukuls are being started in English medium to provide high-quality education, he added. "Earlier...subsidies [for minorities] were only 20 to 30%, but after the formation of Telangana, KCR increased them to 60 to 95%," Eshwar said.

310.title: 22 killed, 33 injured as bus hits truck in south Egypt
310.article_body: At least 22 people were killed and 33 people were injured when a passenger bus hit a trailer truck in southern Egypt's Minya province on Tuesday. The trailer truck's tire was being changed on the roadside of a highway which links Egypt's capital Cairo to the country's south when the accident occurred. The passenger bus was going to Cairo.

311.title: Check-in using face recognition at Bengaluru airport from Aug 15
311.article_body: The first phase of Centre's Digi Yatra project, which allows passengers to check in at airport using facial recognition technology, will commence at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport on August 15. Under the project, passengers will pass through check-points through a contactless process, using facial features to establish their identities, which would be linked to boarding passes.

312.title: India & China to maintain stability along LAC after 16th round of talks
312.article_body: India and China agreed to maintain stability on ground and resolve relevant issues pertaining to Line of Actual Control (LAC) in 16th round of corps commander-level talks held on Sunday. In a joint press release, both sides reaffirmed that resolution of remaining issues would enable progress in bilateral ties. Talks were held at Chushul-Moldo border meeting point on Indian side.

313.title: K'taka family announces ₹50,000 reward for finding missing parrot
313.article_body: A family that rears parrots at home in Karnataka's Tumakuru has announced that anybody who returns their missing parrot or gives information about it will be given ₹50,000 as reward. Animal activist Ravi, who owns the African grey parrot, said 'Rustuma' has been missing since Saturday from Jayanagar locality. "By mistake, it has flown away...It cannot go far," Ravi added.

314.title: I don't think I am the best player right now: World no. 6 Alcaraz
314.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz said he doesn't think that he's the best player currently. "I mean, Novak Djokovic won Wimbledon, Rafael Nadal [won] Roland-Garros and Australian Open, so there are a lot of great players ahead of me right now," he added. The 19-year-old Spaniard has won four ATP titles this year, including two Masters 1000s.

315.title: Estonia's new government headed by PM Kaja Kallas sworn in
315.article_body: Estonia's new government has been sworn in, giving Prime Minister Kaja Kallas a ruling majority. Last week, Kallas resigned after the previous coalition government was disbanded over ally Centre Party's opposition to the government's reform of primary education. The new government will last till the elections in March 2023.

316.title: 1 accused in Haryana DSP's killing arrested; was shot in leg in encounter
316.article_body: One person involved in the killing of Tauru DSP Surender Singh in Haryana's Nuh has been arrested, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has confirmed. According to police, the accused was arrested after an encounter, during which he was shot in the leg. "Other [accused] will be arrested soon...We're very serious as the attack has happened on our police," Vij added.

317.title: Mumbai airport sees 132% growth in passenger traffic in 6 months
317.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport has seen a 132% increase in passenger traffic in the first six months of 2022, compared to the first six months of 2021, reports said. Around 1.30 lakh flight movements were recorded across domestic and international destinations and 1.336 crore domestic passengers travelled via 97,460 flights. May was the best month for air travel.

318.title: Srinagar makes masks compulsory at public places as COVID cases rise
318.article_body: The district administration in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Tuesday made use of face masks compulsory at all public places with immediate effect because of a spike in COVID-19 cases. The rule will be in place till further orders. All district and sectoral officers have been asked to ensure the usage of face masks by all officials in the office.

319.title: Udhayakumar elected as Deputy Leader of Opposition in TN Assembly
319.article_body: AIADMK has elected MLA RB Udhayakumar as Deputy Leader of the Opposition in Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly. The post was earlier held by former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam, who was expelled from the party earlier this month. Further, MLA SS Krishnamurthy has replaced Manoj Pandian as AIADMK's Deputy Secretary. Earlier, Pandian was expelled from the party for supporting Panneerselvam.

320.title: Nearly 30,000 recruited in J&K's public sector since 2019: Govt
320.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has recruited nearly 30,000 people in the public sector since 2019, Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said in Lok Sabha on Tuesday. Rai added that 5.2 lakh people were employed through the self-employment schemes from August 2019 to June 2022. In August 2019, Jammu and Kashmir's special status was scrapped.

321.title: Distance criteria for EWS admissions in Delhi pvt schools changed to 3 km
321.article_body: Economically Weaker Section (EWS) students seeking admissions in Delhi's private schools will be able to choose an institution within 3 kms (instead of the earlier 1 km) of their residence, the Directorate of Education said. In a computerised draw of lots, students in a 1-km radius are selected and chances of those residing 3 kms away get minimised, officials said.

322.title: Dog-like robot with a virtual spinal cord learns to walk in 1 hour; video released
322.article_body: A dog-like robot with a "virtual spinal cord" has learned to walk from scratch in just one hour, researchers from Germany's Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems claimed. The robot, named Morti, features reflexes just like an animal and learns from its mistakes. It continuously compares sent and expected sensor information, runs reflex loops, and adapts its motor control patterns.

323.title: I painted his face but was still recognised: Ex-Barcelona player on Ronaldo
323.article_body: Former Barcelona player Boudewijn Zenden revealed an interesting story of his teammate and Brazilian footballer, Ronaldo Nazario, when the latter had recently won the 1994 FIFA World Cup. "I took Ronaldo to...the best yearly carnival [of] the Netherlands...He wore a clown outfit...and I painted his face, but people still recognised him. His smile...revealed his true identity," Zenden said.

324.title: Hottest day recorded in history of UK as temperatures cross 40°C for 1st time
324.article_body: The hottest day has been recorded in the history of UK as temperatures hit 40.2°C at London Heathrow Airport on Tuesday. The previous hottest day in UK (38.7°C) was recorded in Cambridge University Botanic Garden on July 25, 2019. Many sites across UK surpassed the 2019 record today. Charlwood recorded temperatures of 39.9°C, while temperatures reached 39.6°C in Kew Gardens.

325.title: Hyderabad reported zero bad air days from 2019-21: Govt
325.article_body: Hyderabad reported zero bad air days from 2019 to 2021, as per a parliamentary report from the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change. Hyderabad's air quality index (AQI) was below 200 during this period. Visakhapatnam saw 25 bad air days in 2019, 23 in 2020 and 21 in 2021.

326.title: 12,611 enemy properties left behind by Pakistani, Chinese citizens
326.article_body: A total of 12,611 enemy properties were left behind by people who have taken citizenship of Pakistan and China, the Lok Sabha was informed on Tuesday. Union Minister of State for Home Ajay Kumar Mishra said out of the 12,611 properties, 12,485 were related to Pakistani nationals and 126 to Chinese citizens.

327.title: 4 men arrested for offering namaz at Lulu mall in Uttar Pradesh
327.article_body: Four men were arrested by the Uttar Pradesh Police on Tuesday, days after a video of them allegedly offering namaz at Lulu mall in Lucknow surfaced online. The accused were identified after checking surveillance footage from the mall, police said. The arrests came following demands of several Hindu right wing groups seeking permission to recite Hanuman Chalisa in the mall.

328.title: Brazilian Amazon lost 18 trees per second in 2021: Report
328.article_body: According to a report by Mapbiomas, deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon increased by more than 20% in 2021 and the rainforest faced deforestation at a rate of 18 trees per second. The report added that Brazil lost 42,000 square kilometres of tree cover in the last three years, a landmass equivalent to the area of the Rio de Janeiro state.

329.title: Baby-sized fibroid removed from 38-yr-old woman's uterus in Pune
329.article_body: A 5.6 kg fibroid, equivalent to the size of a full-term baby, was removed surgically from the uterus of a 38-year-old woman in Pune. "On arrival, we found that [the patient]...had a history of...abnormally heavy...bleeding and anaemia for a year," a doctor said. The patient, who was operated upon for two hours, was discharged 50 hours after her surgery.

330.title: Eka Care, platform which digitises medical records, raises $15 mn
330.article_body: Healthtech startup Eka Care, which helps digitise the medical records of Indian patients, has raised $15 million in its Series A round. The round, led by Hummingbird Ventures, saw participation from 3one4 Capital, Mirae Assets, Verlinvest, Aditya Birla Ventures, among others. Founded in 2020 by Vikalp Sahni and Deepak Tuli, the platform has over 30 million users and 5,000 doctors.

331.title: Artisan marketplace Lal10 raises $5.5 mn in pre-Series A round
331.article_body: Lal10, a cross-border marketplace for Indian artisans, raised $5.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The round, led by Yuj Ventures and Beyond Capital Ventures, saw participation from Spiral Ventures, Singularity Ventures, Asymmetry Ventures among others, and some prominent angels. Founded in 2017 by Maneet Gohil, Sanchit Govil and Albin Jose, the firm caters to grassroots MSMEs in India.

332.title: 90% road repair work completed in 3 days: Pune civic body
332.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Tuesday claimed that it has completed around 90% work to repair potholes in the city in just three days from July 15 to 18. PMC filled 848 potholes, repaired 65 chamber lids in this period, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. However, citizens living near the affected areas still complain about the poor condition of roads.

333.title: Cancel arms deal with Taiwan immediately: China to US
333.article_body: China has sought an immediate cancellation of the latest arms deal between the US and Taiwan, Chinese state media reported on Monday citing the country's Defence Ministry. On Friday, the Pentagon said that the US Department of State had given its nod for the potential sale of military technical assistance worth an estimated $108 million to Taiwan.

334.title: Commerce enablement firm AnyMind Group raises $29.4 mn in funding
334.article_body: AnyMind Group, an end-to-end commerce enablement company, has raised $29.4 million in a Series D funding round. Additionally, the company has also secured a $7.2 million credit facility from Japan-based corporate banking unit Mizuho Bank. So far, the brand support platform has acquired seven companies from various countries including Japan, Hong Kong, Thailand and India.

335.title: Filmmaker Avinash Das detained for sharing pic of Amit Shah with jailed IAS officer Pooja
335.article_body: Filmmaker Avinash Das was detained on Tuesday afternoon outside his Mumbai residence by a team of Gujarat Police. He was detained in connection with a case where he shared a photo on social media of Home Minister Amit Shah with arrested IAS officer Pooja Singhal. He is being brought to Ahmedabad for further action, an official said.

336.title: DCW issues notice after woman gives birth outside Safdarjung Hospital
336.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women has issued a notice to Safdarjung Hospital's Medical Superintendent after a woman gave birth on the floor outside the building of the hospital. The woman's family alleged that she was denied a maternity ward. However, a hospital spokesperson said that they did not deny the woman permission, adding that there was a lapse in communication.

337.title: Man detained for trying to chop off minor boy's ears in Assam
337.article_body: Police have detained a man in Assam's Tinsukia district for allegedly trying to chop off the ears of a minor boy who was reportedly in a relationship with his daughter. "Nearly half of both his ears were cut," said a staffer of the nursing home treating the victim. According to police, the boy was "mercilessly" beaten before the attempted mutilation.

338.title: Hardik a changed man now, I see sense of ambition in him: Manjrekar
338.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya, Sanjay Manjrekar said the India all-rounder is a changed man now. "I see a sense of ambition coming into him. And once you have that, wanting to grow within Indian cricket then there's tremendous motivation," he added. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India's 2-1 win in three-match ODI series against England.

339.title: Over 1,500 people killed in elephant attacks in last 3 years: Govt
339.article_body: About 1,578 people have died in elephant attacks in the country in the last three years, according to data shared by the Union Environment Ministry in Lok Sabha. Out of the total deaths reported due to elephant attacks, 585 people died in 16 states during 2019-20, 461 fatalities occurred in 2020-21 and 532 people died in 2021-22, the ministry added.

340.title: Tamil Nadu govt transfers Kallakurichi Collector, SP after violence over girl's death
340.article_body: Tamil Nadu government on Tuesday transferred Kallakurichi District Collector PN Sridhar and Superintendent of Police (SP) S Selvakumar, days after violence broke out following a Class 12 girl's death. Sravan Kumar Jatavath has been posted as the new collector and P Pakalavan will take charge as the SP. The state has formed a Special Investigation Team to probe the violence.

341.title: Govt lists countries preferred by people who gave up Indian citizenship in 2021
341.article_body: Over 1.6 lakh people gave up Indian citizenship in 2021, the Union Ministry of Home Affairs' data released on Tuesday said. The US was the most-preferred country by such people, followed by Australia, Canada and the UK. Italy, New Zealand, Singapore, Germany, the Netherlands and Sweden were also among the top 10 nations where expats renounced Indian citizenship in 2021.

342.title: Star Sports bags Cricket Australia media rights for next 4-yr cycle: Reports
342.article_body: Star Sports has reportedly bagged the media rights to broadcast Australian cricket in India for the upcoming four-year cycle. Cricket Australia and the sports broadcaster are reported to have signed the contract, which includes a clause to extend the arrangement by an additional four years. The cycle will likely begin from the start of this year's Australian cricket season.

343.title: Will use entire police reserve if needed: Anil Vij on catching DSP's killers
343.article_body: After Tauru DSP was allegedly killed by a mining mafia in Haryana's Nuh district, state Home Minister Anil Vij said, "Every single one of them (accused) will be apprehended." "I told the DGP that a reply to this incident will be given, even if he has to use police force of the entire district, nearby districts or reserve," Vij added.

344.title: COVID-19 cases triple across Europe, hospitalisations double: WHO
344.article_body: The World Health Organization has said that COVID-19 cases have tripled across Europe in the past six weeks. "Hospitalisation rates...have doubled in the same period," it added. The 53 nations in WHO's European region reported nearly 3 million new cases last week, accounting for nearly half of all infections globally. Reportedly, Europe is seeing about 3,000 coronavirus-related deaths every week.

345.title: Seeking money for 'ailing' mom, man cheats Pune BJP MLA of ₹3,400
345.article_body: A case has been registered against a man for allegedly cheating a BJP MLA from Pune of ₹3,400 by claiming that he needed money to buy medicines for his ailing mother, police said on Tuesday. Madhuri Misal said that she received a call, following which she asked her daughter to transfer the money to the given number.

346.title: K'taka govt to oppose Centre's draft notification on ESA in Western Ghats
346.article_body: Karnataka government has decided to oppose Centre's draft notification on Ecologically Sensitive Areas (ESA) in the Western Ghats. Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said, "MLAs cutting across party lines have unanimously expressed their opposition to the notification...A delegation of Lok Sabha members and MLAs...headed by CM (Basavaraj Bommai), will meet the Union Environment Minister."

347.title: Japan fisherman stabs over 30 sea turtles to death in 'frustration'
