347.article_body: A Japanese fisherman has confessed to stabbing 30-50 sea turtles to death in "frustration" after they got caught in his fishing net, officials said. The sea turtles, which are protected creatures, were found with stab wounds on their necks and other body parts on a beach on Kumejima island last week. The fisherman, who hasn't been named, expressed regret later.

348.title: No: MoS Rai as MP asks whether terror attacks are rising in India
348.article_body: After Lok Sabha MP A Ganeshamurthi asked whether incidents of terror attacks are rising in India, Union Minister of State (MoS) for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai replied, "No, Sir." The MoS said, "The security situation has improved significantly in Jammu and Kashmir...There has been a substantial decline in terrorist attacks from 417 in 2018 to 229 in 2021."

349.title: Fire breaks out at residential building in East Delhi; 12 rescued
349.article_body: A fire broke out at a four-storey residential building in East Delhi's New Ashok Nagar on Tuesday, officials said. Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said, "Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot and so far 12 people have been rescued." The fire broke out on the building's first floor and the incident's cause is being ascertained, Garg added.

350.title: Haryana CM announces ₹1 cr aid for DSP killed by mining mafia, vows strict action
350.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar announced financial assistance of ₹1 crore for the family of DSP Surender Singh, who was allegedly killed by the mining mafia in Nuh on Tuesday. Khattar also announced a government job for one of Singh's family members. The CM said he has directed authorities to take the strictest possible action against the accused.

351.title: Not nailed yet: Marnus Labuschagne on his ODI spot for 2023 World Cup
351.article_body: Marnus Labuschagne has said he's targeting to be part of Australia's squad for the 2023 ODI World Cup. He, however, also stated that he's yet to nail down a spot in the XI. "I certainly haven't been performing as well as I want to," he added. Labuschagne has played 21 ODIs, scoring 677 runs, including one century and four fifties.

352.title: Olympic champion Rojas wins third straight triple jump World C'ships gold
352.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Yulimar Rojas of Venezuela won her third consecutive triple jump gold at the World Athletics Championships after she jumped 15.47 metres in Oregon on Monday. "This is a special competition for me," said Rojas. Jamaican Shanieka Ricketts clinched her second consecutive world silver with a 14.89-metre jump, while American Tori Franklin took bronze (14.72 metres).

353.title: He was retiring this yr, has 2 kids: Brother of Haryana DSP killed amid mining raid
353.article_body: The younger brother of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was run over by a truck during an illegal mining raid, has said the officer was due for retirement this year. "I spoke with him today only," said Singh's brother Ashok Manju, adding, "He has two children." Singh was on a surprise inspection based on a tip-off, said ADG Ravi Kiran.

354.title: After Carmel Convent mishap, survey says 72 Chandigarh dry trees need felling
354.article_body: After Carmel Convent school incident in Chandigarh, a fresh survey of 204 schools has found that 72 dead and dry trees need felling. UT Adviser Dharam Pal has given a week to municipal corporation and UT Engineering and Forest Departments to cut these trees down. This comes after a student lost her life after tree fell on her in city.

355.title: 5-month pregnant woman given abortion pill by husband in UP, dies
355.article_body: A five-month pregnant woman from Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya district died after her husband gave her an abortion pill. The 27-year-old woman's parents alleged that she started bleeding excessively after consuming the medicine. Her relatives then took her to a hospital where she was declared brought dead. The woman's parents have demanded action against her husband and his family.

356.title: UP man impersonates Bombay HC CJ, tries to cheat officers; held
356.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been arrested from UP for allegedly impersonating the Chief Justice of Bombay HC Dipankar Datta and trying to cheat court officers. The police said that the accused had set Justice Datta's name and photo as a display picture on WhatsApp and sent out messages to officers demanding Amazon Pay gift cards.

357.title: Bus overturns in UP after driver tries to avoid hitting stray animal; 1 dead
357.article_body: A Kanpur-Meerut bound bus overturned near Harchandpur village in Etah, Uttar Pradesh, leading to the death of one person, Jaswant (45), and injuring 18 people, including 5 women. The bus met with an accident after the driver lost control while trying to avoid hitting the stray animal that came in front of the vehicle, police said.

358.title: B'luru woman tears down illegal hoarding wishing BJP leader on birthday
358.article_body: A woman tore down an illegal flex hoarding installed to wish BJP national general secretary CT Ravi on his birthday in front of Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru on Monday. Social media chief of Congress' Karnataka unit from Belagavi shared a video online in which the woman is seen ripping the poster. "Bindu Gowda boldly tore down the banner," he wrote.

359.title: Sri Lankans protest outside house of ex-Prez Rajapaksa's son in US
359.article_body: A group of Sri Lankan protesters gathered outside house of ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's son Manoj in Los Angeles and demanded that Rajapaksa returns to Sri Lanka. The protest that took place last week comes amid ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka. Gotabaya, who has resigned as President, is currently in Singapore on a "private visit", Singapore government said.

360.title: Picasso sketch worth over ₹3.6 cr seized by Spanish customs
360.article_body: Spanish customs officials at Ibiza Airport seized a Picasso sketch worth over €450,000 (over ₹3.6 crore) after a traveller failed to declare the artwork. The unnamed passenger, who arrived from Switzerland, initially attempted to pass the 1966 sketch, named Trois personnages, as a copy. But a gallery invoice discovered in his luggage appeared to identify the work as an original.

361.title: Shehnaaz Gill to join Anil, Bhumi in Rhea Kapoor's next: Reports
361.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill has reportedly signed on to star in Rhea Kapoor's next film. It'll reportedly be helmed by Rhea's husband Karan Boolani. She'll be seen sharing screen space with Anil Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar in the forthcoming project, reports said. The film is reportedly a modern take on relationships and will go on floors by the end of this month.

362.title: Delhi govt received 3,500 missed calls to volunteer as 'Paryavaran Mitra'
362.article_body: The Delhi government received 3,500 missed calls from those who want to be registered as 'Paryavaran Mitra', an official statement said on Tuesday. 'Paryavaran Mitra' is an initiative to build a network of people who can work for environmental sustainability. The volunteers will be responsible for increasing greenery, reducing pollution and improving waste management in their areas.

363.title: Body of missing 7-yr-old from Thane found, relative says family is devastated
363.article_body: Body of seven-year-old boy who had fallen in Thane creek last Wednesday has been found in Airoli. "His father used to go by the creek side every morning and wait for some news from the boats that went looking for Rishi. Rishi's mother is still hoping that he would be back healthy...the news...left...family devastated," said a relative of the family.

364.title: Two feared dead after being swept in river in Rajasthan's Pratapgarh
364.article_body: Two men are feared to be dead after they were swept by the strong currents of the Mahi Erav river in the Bawdi village of Rajasthan's Pratapgarh district. The incident happened when the two missing persons, Jeta Delia (25) and Rajeng Singh (22), along with two others were trying to cross the river, the Station House Officer (Ghantali) said.

365.title: Manushi joins John in 'Tehran', says 'This is going to be really special'
365.article_body: Manushi Chhillar has been roped in to star opposite John Abraham in the upcoming film 'Tehran'. The former Miss World, who was recently seen in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', shared a post on Instagram announcing her next film and wrote, "Super excited to join the one & only John Abraham on #Tehran. This journey is going to be really special!"

366.title: SRK has been working to build toned physique for 4 yrs: Trainer on Pathaan
366.article_body: Discussing actor Shah Rukh Khan's toned physique for 'Pathaan', his trainer Prashant Sawant said SRK has been working towards this physique for the last four years. "Everything in diet was...measured...Despite injuries serving as a setback, he came back stronger," added Prashant. "Shah Rukh started doing a lot of [heavy lifting]...Previously, we used to do...circuit training," he stated.

367.title: Government does not maintain data of arrested journalists: MHA
367.article_body: Union Minister for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai, on Tuesday, informed in a written reply in Lok Sabha that the NCRB does not maintain any specific data regarding the arrest of journalists. His remarks came after TMC MP Mala Roy had asked about the total number of journalists arrested in the country since 2019, along with the charges against them.

368.title: Funeral procession of Haryana's law & order taken out: Hooda on DSP's killing
368.article_body: Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda reacted to the killing of Tauru DSP Surender Singh in Nuh on Tuesday. "Funeral procession of Haryana's law and order has been taken out," Hooda added. "The state government has completely failed and criminals are roaming around-both mining mafia and organised gangsters. Organised crime has entered Haryana," Hooda stated.

369.title: Received proposal to change name of West Bengal to Bangla: MHA
369.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs on Tuesday said the Centre has received a proposal from state government to change the name of West Bengal to Bangla. "A proposal has been received from the Government of West Bengal for renaming the state as Bangla in all three languages - Bengali, English and Hindi," Union MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai, said.

370.title: Servant held for stealing gold worth ₹16 lakh from a Mumbai apartment
370.article_body: A 28-year-old servant, Chhotu Laxman Mandal, was arrested for allegedly stealing gold biscuits worth over ₹16 lakh from an apartment in Mumbai's Grant Road, police said. "The theft had taken place a week ago on July 11, when the...employer was visiting her son, who had met with an accident," police said. An FIR was registered under IPC section 381(theft).

371.title: Highways within 100 km of LoC, borders will not need green nod: Centre
371.article_body: Centre exempted highway projects related to defence and strategic importance within 100 kilometres of the Line of Control (LoC) and borders from seeking a green nod. "Such projects are sensitive in nature...need to be executed on priority keeping in view strategic...security considerations," the Centre added. It also exempted projects pertaining to the expansion of terminal buildings at airports.

372.title: KGF's Yash, wife Radhika's debut film completes 14 yrs, actress shares post
372.article_body: Actress Radhika Pandit, wife of 'KGF' actor Yash, has shared a post on Instagram celebrating 14 years of the film 'Moggina Manasu', which marked her and Yash's debut in the film industry. Sharing a few stills from the film, Radhika wrote, "This film has given me so much...A Filmfare award, State award and a life partner...couldn't have asked for more!!"

373.title: Tejashwi offered support to protect family from going to jail: Bihar BJP chief
373.article_body: Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said RJD's Tejashwi Yadav was ready to support BJP in government formation in Bihar to "protect himself and his family from going to jail". His statement came after Yadav said MoS Home Nityanand Rai had expressed his desire to join RJD. "No matter how much they try, Tejashwi and family will be jailed," Jaiswal added.

374.title: Govt putting more tax burden on people: Siddaramaiah on GST hike
374.article_body: Criticising the Central government over the latest hike of Goods and Services Tax (GST) on various essential food items, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said the government is putting more tax burden on people instead of helping them. "Depriving people of their food is 'Acche Din' for Narendra Modi-led government," Siddaramaiah tweeted. He further termed GST as 'Gabbar Singh Tax'.

375.title: KL Rahul faces Jhulan Goswami in nets at NCA, video goes viral
375.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Indian men's cricket team batter KL Rahul facing India Women pacer Jhulan Goswami in the nets at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. Rahul has started net practice days after undergoing a successful groin surgery in Germany. Rahul has been included in Team India's T20I squad for West Indies series subject to fitness.

376.title: 1 labourer dead, 18 missing near Indo-China border In Arunachal
376.article_body: One labourer has died and 18 others have gone missing along the Indo-China border in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey, District Deputy Commissioner Bengia Nighee has confirmed. Most of the 19 labourers, who went missing since July 5 from a construction site of a road project, were from Assam, Nighee added. The deceased's body was found in a nearby river.

377.title: Chinese authorities break into homes to look for COVID contacts, apologise
377.article_body: Authorities in southern China have apologised for breaking into the homes of people who had been taken to a COVID-19 quarantine hotel. Officials in Guangzhou reportedly broke into 84 homes to check for hidden close contacts and to disinfect the premises. The doors of the houses were later sealed and new locks were installed, as per the local media.

378.title: Funds slashed for Jamia & AMU, raised for BHU: Govt in Parliament
378.article_body: Funds allocated to Jamia Millia Islamia were reduced by ₹68.73 crore and Aligarh Muslim University by ₹306 crore in FY 2021-22 as compared to the previous fiscal, the government said in Parliament. According to MoS Education Subhas Sarkar, Banaras Hindu University was allocated ₹1,303.01 crore in FY 2021-22, almost double from ₹669.51 crore in FY 2014-15.

379.title: Rishabh Pant can be the future captain after Rohit Sharma: Arun Lal
379.article_body: Ex-India batter Arun Lal has said wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant can be Team India's future captain after Rohit Sharma. "He (Pant) is someone who is not afraid to play his game, can handle pressure well, can take the team out of tough situations and such a player can be a great leader," added Lal. Currently, Pant leads Delhi Capitals in IPL.

380.title: Cow urine will be used to make medicines in Chhattisgarh: CM Baghel
380.article_body: Soon after the announcement that Chhattisgarh government will purchase cow urine at ₹4 per litre, CM Bhupesh Baghel said that cow urine will be used to make medicines in the state to promote organic farming. "Our government is directly putting money in the pockets of people while Centre is taking money out of the pockets," Baghel added.

381.title: 3 arrested for stealing ₹12.2 crore from a private bank in Thane
381.article_body: Three persons were arrested for allegedly stealing ₹12.20 crore from a private bank in Thane, an official said on Tuesday. The police recovered ₹5.80 crore out of the stolen cash and property worth ₹10 lakh from the accused, Senior Police Inspector Anil Honrao stated. The police is looking for the main accused and others involved in the crime, Honrao added.

382.title: Manoj Bajpayee approached for role of police officer in Pushpa 2: Reports
382.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has been reportedly approached to play the role of a police officer in 'Pushpa: The Rule', which is a sequel to Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa'. Actor Vijay Sethupathi has also been reportedly approached to play an important role, having opted out of the first part due to date issues. 'Pushpa' featured Fahadh Faasil in a police officer's role.

383.title: Hardik is India's most valuable player in white-ball cricket: Aakash
383.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya is currently Team India's most valuable player in white-ball cricket. "If Hardik is fit, his replacement is not available...The team has asked more, he has delivered more. So this has been an extremely beautiful thing," stated Aakash. Hardik picked four wickets and then scored 71 runs in the final ODI against England.

384.title: 2 men cheat 68-yr-old Mumbai man of ₹22 lakh by borrowing phone to play games
384.article_body: A retired BEST employee, Parkash Naik (68), was defrauded of over ₹22 lakh by two men after they allegedly transferred the money by borrowing Naik's mobile on the pretext of playing games. The accused, Shubham and Amar, were arrested after transferring the money to multiple accounts via UPI, police said. Notably, Naik filed the complaint at the Dindoshi Police Station.

385.title: Army personnel entitled to disability pension if it's attributable to service: SC
385.article_body: Army personnel will be entitled to disability pension only if the disability is attributed to military service or was aggravated by such service and if such condition is more than 20%, the Supreme Court said. The bench was hearing an appeal filed by the government challenging an order of the Armed Forces Tribunal which granted disability pension to army personnel.

386.title: Summer Olympics 2028 in Los Angeles to be held from July 14-30
386.article_body: The opening ceremony of the Summer Olympics 2028 in Los Angeles will be held on July 14 while the Games will conclude on July 30, organiser LA28 announced. The Los Angeles 2028 Paralympic Games will start on August 15 and close on August 27. Notably, the Paralympic Games will be hosted by Los Angeles for the first time ever.

387.title: Facebook Co-founder Saverin's B Capital raises $250 mn for 1st venture fund
387.article_body: B Capital Group, an investment firm run by Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin, raised $250 million for its first early-stage venture fund. The firm already has over $6 billion in assets under management. B Capital Chairman Howard Morgan said the firm plans to invest up to $2 million in seed rounds and $6-8 million in Series A rounds.

388.title: International child pornography racket busted in Gujarat, 1 arrested
388.article_body: The Gujarat Police on Tuesday claimed to have busted an international child pornography racket being run from the state's capital Gandhinagar. Police also arrested one accused in the case who confessed to running four international WhatsApp groups having members from countries like Russia and France. Around 600 photos and 224 videos were recovered from the arrested accused, police said.

389.title: Kids swim in MP school's campus as it floods after heavy rains; video viral
389.article_body: A video of students swimming in a government school's campus as it floods and "turns into a pool" amid heavy rains in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni has gone viral. A school staffer apparently took the video of the children, who'd been playing football before they started swimming. A person reportedly reacted to it, saying, "Aapda Me Avsar (opportunity in disaster)".

390.title: I'd pay for his funeral, jokes Akshay on what he'll do if Chris Rock makes fun of Twinkle
390.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar, during his appearance on Koffee With Karan season 7, was asked how he would react if comedian Chris Rock made a joke about his wife Twinkle Khanna. "I would pay for his funeral," Akshay jokingly replied. Chris Rock was slapped by Will Smith at Oscars for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith.

391.title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani becomes 4th richest?
391.article_body: Gautam Adani has overtaken Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person with a $114 billion fortune, said Forbes. Elon Musk is the world's richest with $230 billion wealth, followed by Bernard Arnault ($148 billion) and Jeff Bezos ($139 billion). Larry Ellison, Warren Buffett, and Larry Page rank 6th, 7th and 8th on the world's 10 richest people list.

392.title: Man runs & gropes burqa-clad woman from behind on Pak street; video leads to outrage
392.article_body: A video of a man groping a burqa-clad woman from behind in broad daylight on a street in Pakistan's Islamabad has led to outrage in the country. The video shows the man running and attacking the woman. Responding to the video shared by a journalist, police assured action against the unidentified accused.

393.title: K'taka allows govt colleges to use student fees for development works
393.article_body: Karnataka government has allowed prescribed fees collected from students in 430 government first-grade, 91 polytechnic and 14 engineering colleges to be used for the development of the respective institutions. "The government aims to give financial autonomy to educational institutions...the respective institutions should be allowed to arrange their resources smoothly," an official order reads.

394.title: Arunachal court rejects bail plea of BJP MLA who is accused of rape
394.article_body: A court in Arunachal Pradesh on Monday rejected the anticipatory bail plea of BJP MLA from Koloriang, Lokam Tassar, who is accused of raping a pregnant woman at his residence. State CM Pema Khandu said that BJP will take action against Tassar if the allegations are proven to be true, adding, "No one is above...law." Tassar has been evading arrest.

395.title: K'taka makes hoisting Tricolour must in madrasas from Aug 11 to 17
395.article_body: The Karnataka government has made it compulsory for the madrasas in the state to hoist the national flag for six days from August 11 to 17 to celebrate 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'. The order will also apply to other educational institutions, both government and private. Teachers and non-teaching staff have been directed to hoist the Tricolour at their residences.

396.title: US will bear consequences of Pelosi's visit to Taiwan: China
396.article_body: China's Foreign Ministry on Tuesday said that US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan would seriously undermine China's sovereignty and territorial integrity. The US would have to bear the consequences of the visit, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said. This comes after the Financial Times reported that Pelosi was planning to visit China-claimed Taiwan in August.

397.title: Flipkart's Cleartrip suffers data breach, no sensitive info compromised
397.article_body: Global online travel company Cleartrip suffered a data breach on Monday, according to the company's email to its customers. "There has been a security anomaly that entailed illegal and unauthorised access to a part of Cleartrip's internal systems," the email read. While some personal details were a part of the leak, no sensitive information was compromised, the Flipkart-owned firm said.

398.title: Pak man who entered India to kill Nupur Sharma detained in Raj, 11-inch knife seized
398.article_body: A Pakistani national was detained in Rajasthan after he crossed the International Border to allegedly kill suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. An 11-inch long knife, religious books, clothes and sand were found in the bag of the man identified as Rizwan Ashraf, a senior BSF officer said. He was held on Saturday (July 16) near the Hindumalkot border outpost.

399.title: Anil charged ₹10 cr for 'JugJugg...', Kiara charged ₹3 cr: Report
399.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor charged ₹10 crore for 'JugJugg Jeeyo', according to a report. Meanwhile, Neetu Kapoor, director Raj Mehta and Kiara Advani together charged ₹12 crore, with ₹4 crore going to Neetu, ₹5 crore to Raj and ₹3 crore to Kiara, report said. Varun Dhawan reportedly worked on profit-sharing basis. The film has earned ₹83.12 crore in India so far.

400.title: 65-yr-old man blackmails, rapes neighbour for 26 yrs in Mumbai; arrested
400.article_body: A 65-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing his former neighbour for 26 years in Mumbai. The accused threatened to show photos and videos of the first time he raped the woman to her sons, assaulted her repeatedly and extorted ₹5-6 lakh from her. She approached police when he demanded to get her daughter-in-law to sleep with him.

401.title: Woman, her 7-yr-old daughter die after house collapses in Amravati
401.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her seven-year-old daughter were killed and three other family members sustained injuries after their house collapsed in Maharashtra's Amravati on Tuesday. An official said the old house might have collapsed due to heavy rainfall in the region.The three family members were rescued from under the debris by their neighbours and other people, the official added.
